commit_message:
Remove OSH Authors copyright

The current copyright refers to a non-existent group
"openstack helm authors" with often out-of-date references that
are confusing when adding a new file to the repo.

This change removes all references to this copyright by the
non-existent group and any blank lines underneath.

Change-Id: Ia035037e000f1bf95202fc07b8cd1ad0fc019094

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-24 22:09:23.000000000', 'message': 'Wait before deleting trunk bridges for DPDK vhu

DPDK vhostuser mode (DPDK/vhu) means that when an instance is powered
off the port is deleted, and when an instance is powered on a port is
created.  This means a reboot is functionally a super fast
delete-then-create.  Neutron trunking mode in combination with DPDK/vhu
implements a trunk bridge for each tenant, and the ports for the
instances are created as subports of that bridge.  The standard way a
trunk bridge works is that when all the subports are deleted, a thread
is spawned to delete the trunk bridge, because that is an expensive and
time-consuming operation.  That means that if the port in question is
the only port on the trunk on that compute node, this happens:

1. The port is deleted
2. A thread is spawned to delete the trunk
3. The port is recreated

If the trunk is deleted after #3 happens then the instance has no
networking and is inaccessible; this is the scenario that was dealt with
in a previous change [1].  But there continue to be issues with errors
"RowNotFound: Cannot find Bridge with name=tbr-XXXXXXXX-X".  What is
happening in this case is that the trunk is being deleted in the middle
of the execution of #3, so that it stops existing in the middle of the
port creation logic but before the port is actually recreated.

Since this is a timing issue between two different threads it's
difficult to stamp out entirely, but I think the best way to do it is to
add a slight delay in the trunk deletion thread, just a second or two.
That will give the port time to come back online and avoid the trunk
deletion entirely.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/623275

Change-Id: I36a98fe5da85da1f3a0315dd1a470f062de6f38b

commit_message:
Wait before deleting trunk bridges for DPDK vhu

DPDK vhostuser mode (DPDK/vhu) means that when an instance is powered
off the port is deleted, and when an instance is powered on a port is
created.  This means a reboot is functionally a super fast
delete-then-create.  Neutron trunking mode in combination with DPDK/vhu
implements a trunk bridge for each tenant, and the ports for the
instances are created as subports of that bridge.  The standard way a
trunk bridge works is that when all the subports are deleted, a thread
is spawned to delete the trunk bridge, because that is an expensive and
time-consuming operation.  That means that if the port in question is
the only port on the trunk on that compute node, this happens:

1. The port is deleted
2. A thread is spawned to delete the trunk
3. The port is recreated

If the trunk is deleted after #3 happens then the instance has no
networking and is inaccessible; this is the scenario that was dealt with
in a previous change [1].  But there continue to be issues with errors
"RowNotFound: Cannot find Bridge with name=tbr-XXXXXXXX-X".  What is
happening in this case is that the trunk is being deleted in the middle
of the execution of #3, so that it stops existing in the middle of the
port creation logic but before the port is actually recreated.

Since this is a timing issue between two different threads it's
difficult to stamp out entirely, but I think the best way to do it is to
add a slight delay in the trunk deletion thread, just a second or two.
That will give the port time to come back online and avoid the trunk
deletion entirely.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/623275

Related-Bug: #1869244
Change-Id: I36a98fe5da85da1f3a0315dd1a470f062de6f38b

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-03 17:21:02.000000000', 'message': "Fix opensuse trusted certificates

There's a bug[1] with the combination of the p11-kit and
ca-certificates-mozilla packages available on the latest built
opensuse-15 node in nodepool (which has not been rebuilt for weeks due
to a separate issue[2]) which causes the standard CA bundle to not be
installed correctly and causes jobs that call to external HTTPS services
to fail. Upgrading both packages in sync fixes the issue.

[1] https://bugzilla.suse.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1154871
[2] http://bugzilla.suse.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1166139

Change-Id: Ia8fdfe12fd9089e178adcb2b5eec997eebada262
Needed-by: https://review.opendev.org/713566
"}]
commit_message:
Fix opensuse trusted certificates

There's a bug[1] with the combination of the p11-kit and
ca-certificates-mozilla packages available on the latest built
opensuse-15 node in nodepool (which has not been rebuilt for weeks due
to a separate issue[2]) which causes the standard CA bundle to not be
installed correctly and causes jobs that call to external HTTPS services
to fail. Upgrading both packages in sync fixes the issue.

[1] https://bugzilla.suse.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1154871
[2] http://bugzilla.suse.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1166139

Change-Id: Ia8fdfe12fd9089e178adcb2b5eec997eebada262
Needed-by: https://review.opendev.org/713566

'}, {'created': '2020-04-03 15:32:08.000000000', 'message': 'Allow ansible_group_vars to be overriden by RoleGroupVars

We have introduced {{role.name}}ExtraGroupVars in THT; which allows an
operator to override any Ansible group vars.

In this patch, we will override the ansible_group_vars (from RoleData)
with the RoleGroupVars defined by THT.

It also updates the unit tests to cover 2 scenarios:

- chrony_host set to localhost in RoleData but overriden by 192.168.2.1
  in RoleGroupVars; in actual ansible group vars we end up with
  192.168.2.1.
- chrony_acl set to none in RoleData, never overriden; in actual ansible
  group vars we end up with none.
- chrone_foo isn't set in Role Data, but only by RoleGroupVars and it
  ends up being in actual ansible group vars.

Also, it removes the "if role_name not in role_group_vars" condition, as
the condition is never met. There is always a role_name key in
role_group_vars (e.g. max_fail_percentage, etc).

Change-Id: I2684174bcd9744f0ec0c1ec42cf11d2c467fc7ba
'}]
commit_message:
Allow ansible_group_vars to be overriden by RoleGroupVars

We have introduced {{role.name}}ExtraGroupVars in THT; which allows an
operator to override any Ansible group vars.

In this patch, we will override the ansible_group_vars (from RoleData)
with the RoleGroupVars defined by THT.

It also updates the unit tests to cover 2 scenarios:

- chrony_host set to localhost in RoleData but overriden by 192.168.2.1
  in RoleGroupVars; in actual ansible group vars we end up with
  192.168.2.1.
- chrony_acl set to none in RoleData, never overriden; in actual ansible
  group vars we end up with none.
- chrone_foo isn't set in Role Data, but only by RoleGroupVars and it
  ends up being in actual ansible group vars.

Also, it removes the "if role_name not in role_group_vars" condition, as
the condition is never met. There is always a role_name key in
role_group_vars (e.g. max_fail_percentage, etc).

Change-Id: I2684174bcd9744f0ec0c1ec42cf11d2c467fc7ba

commit_message:

commit_message:
Enable focal gate testing for the vault charm

This adds a focal-mysql8 bundle and adds it to the tests.yaml for gate.
The force_deploy option is used to force Juju to deploy prior to focal
being released.  This will be removed after focal has been released.

Change-Id: Id21ecd438a9979167d66041508a65d0278aa5927
Related-Bug: #1866645

[{'created': '2020-04-03 02:38:43.000000000', 'message': "Introduce scope_types in server external events

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
 - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
 - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for server external events API policies
as 'system'.

Also adds the test case with scope_type enabled and verify we
pass and fail the policy check with expected context.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I33771d8f203d8d49a20e572bd9d3f3d39f90e6f6
"}]
commit_message:
Introduce scope_types in server external events

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
 - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
 - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for server external events API policies
as 'system'.

Also adds the test case with scope_type enabled and verify we
pass and fail the policy check with expected context.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I33771d8f203d8d49a20e572bd9d3f3d39f90e6f6

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-01 18:21:52.000000000', 'message': 'Fix pyScss version in lower-constraints.txt

Horizon requires  pyScss>=1.3.7 [1] but lower-constraints.txt
in manila-ui uses pyScss 1.3.4 which can cause the
failure in future. So this patch update pyScss version in

commit_message:
Fix pyScss version in lower-constraints.txt

Horizon requires  pyScss>=1.3.7 [1] but lower-constraints.txt
in manila-ui uses pyScss 1.3.4 which can cause the
failure in future. So this patch update pyScss version in
lower-constraints.txt to sync the change.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/715241/

Change-Id: I534fd9201e400697875295af352d3d7fbc0de591

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh, to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.

When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing server
external events policies.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

commit_message:
Add test coverage of existing server external events policies

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:
- policy check pass with context having admin or server owner
- policy check fail with context having non-admin and not server owner

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh, to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.

When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing server
external events policies.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I58f6c04b0525526c66615e6b03cee868abbba442

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-03 14:51:04.000000000', 'message': '[DVR] Don't populate unbound ports in router's ARP cache

When user is using keepalived on their instances, he often creates
additional port in Neutron to allocate some IP address which will
be then used as VIP in keepalived and will be configured in
allowed_address_pair of other ports plugged to instances with
keepalived.
This is e.g. Octavia's use case.

This together with DVR caused problems with connectivity to such VIP
as it was populated in router's arp cache with MAC address from
Neutron db.

As this port isn't bound, it is only Neutron db entry so there is no
need to set it in arp cache of the router.
This patch is doing exactly that to filter such "unbound" and
"binding_failed" ports from the list.

Change-Id: Ia885ce00dbb5f2968859e8d0850bc511016f0846
Closes-Bug: #1869887
(cherry picked from commit eb775458c6da57426703289c7b969caddb83d677)
'}]
commit_message:
[DVR] Don't populate unbound ports in router's ARP cache

When user is using keepalived on their instances, he often creates
additional port in Neutron to allocate some IP address which will
be then used as VIP in keepalived and will be configured in
allowed_address_pair of other ports plugged to instances with
keepalived.
This is e.g. Octavia's use case.

This together with DVR caused problems with connectivity to such VIP
as it was populated in router's arp cache with MAC address from
Neutron db.

As this port isn't bound, it is only Neutron db entry so there is no
need to set it in arp cache of the router.
This patch is doing exactly that to filter such "unbound" and
"binding_failed" ports from the list.

Change-Id: Ia885ce00dbb5f2968859e8d0850bc511016f0846
Closes-Bug: #1869887
(cherry picked from commit eb775458c6da57426703289c7b969caddb83d677)

commit_message:
Introduce {{role.name}}ExtraGroupVars

{{role.name}}ExtraGroupVars (e.g. ControllerExtraGroupVars) is a new
interface to override any Ansible group var for a specific role.

If the group var was already defined in a service, the ExtraGroupVars
will override it.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/717170
Change-Id: I3115ea3b1bd14979bad5e2ed45e91107ee969ca9

commit_message:
Update Nova API microversion in nova_client.py.

Cyborg specifically needs Nova API version 2.82, because
that defines the ARQ binding event [1].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/692707/17/nova/api/openstack/api_version_request.py@235

Storyboard: https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2006921

Change-Id: Ib42d145c0d42bf8b0610ce0368fa7eacae40b704

https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/latest/configuration/block-storage/drivers/dell-emc-powermax-driver.html

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-30 14:31:44.000000000', 'message': "[OVN] Change the default metadata_workers to 2

Prior to this patch, the metadata_workers parameter defaults to
$os_workers (calculated here [0]) but, even tho it's capped at 12 workers
this number still redundant.

There are a few differences of how the OVN metadata agent works compared
with the OVS metadata agents:

1) The OVN metadata workers are deployed onto the compute nodes and not
   on the controllers/gateways as the OVS ones are. This means it's
   better distributed.

2) Even tho we could have multiple workers, the OVN SB IDL in the OVN
   metadata agents acquires a lock while listening to OVSDB events.
   Therefore, even tho we could have dozens of agents only one of them
   is listening to the events.

3) Instantiating IDLs means maintaining in-memory replicas of the
   OVSDB (or, the tables of that DB that is being watched). This puts a
   burden on OVSDBs to maintain all these replicas updated, reducing
   this number workers also reduces the burden on the OVSDBs.

This patch is reducing the default number of OVN metadata agents to two
(per compute). Two because that keeps it HA, in case the active agente
dies the lock moves to the other one and the service will keep working.

[0]
https://github.com/openstack/puppet-openstacklib/blob/74e0f5a3170b09632ad4ede7e20d3ebeb4514586/lib/facter/os_workers.rb#L37

Change-Id: I6b9cc2aff14ce38a56c2757d9ad6c56898e27247
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 847f434140ee8435ee842801748a0deccdff8155)
"}]
commit_message:
[OVN] Change the default metadata_workers to 2

Prior to this patch, the metadata_workers parameter defaults to
$os_workers (calculated here [0]) but, even tho it's capped at 12 workers
this number still redundant.

There are a few differences of how the OVN metadata agent works compared
with the OVS metadata agents:

1) The OVN metadata workers are deployed onto the compute nodes and not
   on the controllers/gateways as the OVS ones are. This means it's
   better distributed.

2) Even tho we could have multiple workers, the OVN SB IDL in the OVN
   metadata agents acquires a lock while listening to OVSDB events.
   Therefore, even tho we could have dozens of agents only one of them
   is listening to the events.

3) Instantiating IDLs means maintaining in-memory replicas of the
   OVSDB (or, the tables of that DB that is being watched). This puts a
   burden on OVSDBs to maintain all these replicas updated, reducing
   this number workers also reduces the burden on the OVSDBs.

This patch is reducing the default number of OVN metadata agents to two
(per compute). Two because that keeps it HA, in case the active agente
dies the lock moves to the other one and the service will keep working.

[0]
https://github.com/openstack/puppet-openstacklib/blob/74e0f5a3170b09632ad4ede7e20d3ebeb4514586/lib/facter/os_workers.rb#L37

Change-Id: I6b9cc2aff14ce38a56c2757d9ad6c56898e27247
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 847f434140ee8435ee842801748a0deccdff8155)

commit_message:
Update hacking for Python3

The repo is Python 3 now, so update hacking to version 3.0 which
supports Python 3.

Fix problems found.

Update local hacking checks for new flake8.

Remove check check_python3_no_iteritems since this repo is now python3
only.

Change-Id: Ibe75f412a077325e926366897dc505b6ab34dd6f

You tested it so I'm not going to argue, I was ok with that before and I am even more now, but I'm starting to think there's something wrong in the CentOS 7 IPA image then, since by default mdadm is installed in /usr/sbin.

commit_message:
Software RAID: Add UEFI support

The proposed changes concern two steps:

First, when creating the RAID configuration, have a GPT partition
table type (this is not necessary, but more natural with UEFI).
Also, leave some space, either for the EFI partitions or the BIOS
boot partitions, outside the Software RAID.

Secondly, when installing the bootloader, make sure the correct
boot partitions are created or relocated.

Change-Id: Icf0a76b0de89e7a8494363ec91b2f1afda4faa3b
Story: #2006379
Task: #37635

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg:
  * Wheel is not needed for python 3 only repo
  * Some other sections are obsolete
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore
- Use sphinx-build

Change-Id: I8abd764d97a6711d3e6347ec3a7b8967f1512006

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-02 12:19:00.000000000', 'message': 'Make oslo.i18n an optional dependency

In an ideal world we would have all messages translated to at least major
languages. In reality, ironic has never boasted a great set of translation,
and according to Zanata only 2.94% of messages are translated for ironic
in Train (1.33% for ironic-inspector). Given that ironic-python-agent is
not translated at all, using i18n by default seems an overkill.

Change-Id: I12287c6b7208af487cc9eee825ae7f38ec707d91
'}]
commit_message:
Make oslo.i18n an optional dependency

In an ideal world we would have all messages translated to at least major
languages. In reality, ironic has never boasted a great set of translation,
and according to Zanata only 2.94% of messages are translated for ironic
in Train (1.33% for ironic-inspector). Given that ironic-python-agent is
not translated at all, using i18n by default seems an overkill.

Change-Id: I12287c6b7208af487cc9eee825ae7f38ec707d91

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-06 08:20:45.000000000', 'message': 'Make deploy step failure logging indicate the error

Deploy step logging would previously only log the step to the API
user, instead of anything the API user could use to try and determine
what is wrong.

Example:
- Trying to power on a machine as part of deploy.deploy()
- Power-on operation fails
- Only the deploy step is listed as the error, and no
  additional information to troubleshoot the issue,
  which forced the operator to go examine logs and
  find the error.

Change-Id: If60b96dcafa446de090df56089760eda3a21109d
(cherry picked from commit 6a1d453ef0dd9536e500ff8c45846826dca40e8b)
'}]
commit_message:
Make deploy step failure logging indicate the error

Deploy step logging would previously only log the step to the API
user, instead of anything the API user could use to try and determine
what is wrong.

Example:
- Trying to power on a machine as part of deploy.deploy()
- Power-on operation fails
- Only the deploy step is listed as the error, and no
  additional information to troubleshoot the issue,
  which forced the operator to go examine logs and
  find the error.

Change-Id: If60b96dcafa446de090df56089760eda3a21109d
(cherry picked from commit 6a1d453ef0dd9536e500ff8c45846826dca40e8b)

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg:
  * Wheel is not needed for python 3 only repo
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore

Change-Id: I461fbd3273008bcb40c8fa217c093ba33599a9f3

commit_message:
Remove RBAC code duplication in db_base_plugin_v2

- Reuse as much as possible code from rbac_db module
  in db_base_plugin_v2 to reduce code duplication's.
- Provide detailed TODO with required action items
  for future refactorings.

Change-Id: Id9499ff82ee706bc22c050785cf0222e636026f6

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore
- Switch to building docs with sphinx-build, use apidoc here and fix
  problems found.

Change-Id: I64c07c9e1621518240bfb60efa7f0990b0e7e727

commit_message:
Fix ngs

Fixed the netmiko exception `Timed-out reading channel, data not available.`
Change ngs config to use `::1` instead of `localhost` so instances can
boot without problems.
Change ironic-tempest-ipa-wholedisk-direct-tinyipa-multinode to voting.

Co-Authored-By: Harald Jensås <hjensas@redhat.com>
Change-Id: If5aa586a41c51a996ed0c27b4edf67a30de939ee
Story: #2007500
Task: #39272

commit_message:
Support for mariadb's ed25519 authentication

Add the ability to configure all mysql users to require authenticating
to the server via mariadb's ed25519 auth plugin [1], rather than the
default native authentication [2].

[1] https://mariadb.com/kb/en/authentication-plugin-ed25519/
[2] https://mariadb.com/kb/en/authentication-plugin-mysql_native_password/

(manually adapted to apply cleanly and to support python2)

Depends-On: I1c7b40d110190eba861ed466d2644c2f1abbf7b0
Change-Id: I430ea8e1fa15fb263d1d4ef8c39615021d907f8a
Partial-Bug: #1866093

commit_message:
Introduce scope_types in security groups policy

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
 - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
 - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for security groups API policies
as:
- ['system', 'project'] for security groups policy.

Also adds the test case with scope_type enabled and verify we
pass and fail the policy check with expected context.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: Idf504dee1280017f3a39ad7d9c71110476fe9b45

commit_message:
Add info about affinity requests to the troubleshooting doc

We had recent bug report about a possible regression related to
affinity policy enforcement with parallel server create requests.

It turned out not to be a regression but because of the complexity
around affinity enforcement, it might help to add a section to the
compute troubleshooting doc about it which we could refer to in the
future.

Related-Bug: #1863190

Change-Id: I508c48183a7205d46e13154d4e92d31dfa7f7d78

I pulled the neutron-lib + two neutron changes + the client change into a devstacl, live migrated the db schema and tested a basic create-share-delete workflow manually. It all worked as expected.

I never used rbac rules before, but I found one surprising behavior:

After sharing the address scope via an rbac rule, the target project sees the address scope as shared=True, but the owner project sees it as shared=False. Is that intended?

$ openstack network rbac create --target-project dde2105785d54e3eb89b8c96de88f2d6 --action access_as_shared --type address_scope as0

| target_project_id | dde2105785d54e3eb89b8c96de88f2d6                                                                                                                                 |
+-------------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
$ source openrc demo demo
$ openstack address scope show as0
+------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Field      | Value                                                                                                                                            |
+------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+

| ip_version | 4                                                                                                                                                |
| location   | cloud='', project.domain_id=, project.domain_name=, project.id='88d13e35d1584ec58a1d539d5c9c2b88', project.name=, region_name='RegionOne', zone= |

| project_id | 88d13e35d1584ec58a1d539d5c9c2b88                                                                                                                 |
| shared     | True                                                                                                                                             |
+------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
$ source openrc admin admin
$ openstack address scope show as0
+------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+

+------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+

| location   | cloud='', project.domain_id='default', project.domain_name=, project.id='88d13e35d1584ec58a1d539d5c9c2b88', project.name='admin', region_name='RegionOne', zone= |

| project_id | 88d13e35d1584ec58a1d539d5c9c2b88                                                                                                                                 |

(1 comment)

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > I pulled the neutron-lib + two neutron changes + the client change
 > into a devstacl, live migrated the db schema and tested a basic
 > create-share-delete workflow manually. It all worked as expected.
 > 
 > I never used rbac rules before, but I found one surprising
 > behavior:
 > 
 > After sharing the address scope via an rbac rule, the target
 > project sees the address scope as shared=True, but the owner
 > project sees it as shared=False. Is that intended?
 > 
 > $ source openrc admin admin
 > $ openstack network rbac create --target-project dde2105785d54e3eb89b8c96de88f2d6
 > --action access_as_shared --type address_scope as0

 > project.domain_name=, project.id='88d13e35d1584ec58a1d539d5c9c2b88',
 > project.name='admin', region_name='RegionOne', zone= |

 > | object_id         | c1f0f190-5194-4bd7-a20a-d753d613a102         
 >                                                                    
 >                                                |
 > | object_type       | address_scope                                
 >                                                                    
 >                                                |
 > | project_id        | 88d13e35d1584ec58a1d539d5c9c2b88             
 >                                                                    
 >                                                |
 > | target_project_id | dde2105785d54e3eb89b8c96de88f2d6             
 >                                                                    
 >                                                |
 > +-------------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
 > $ source openrc demo demo
 > $ openstack address scope show as0
 > +------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
 > | Field      | Value                                               
 >                                                                    
 >                         |
 > +------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
 > | id         | c1f0f190-5194-4bd7-a20a-d753d613a102

 >                         |
 > | ip_version | 4                                                   
 >                                                                    
 >                         |
 > | location   | cloud='', project.domain_id=, project.domain_name=,
 > project.id='88d13e35d1584ec58a1d539d5c9c2b88', project.name=,
 > region_name='RegionOne', zone= |
 > | name       | as0                                                 
 >                                                                    
 >                         |
 > | project_id | 88d13e35d1584ec58a1d539d5c9c2b88                    
 >                                                                    
 >                         |
 > | shared     | True                                                
 >                                                                    
 >                         |
 > +------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
 > $ source openrc admin admin
 > $ openstack address scope show as0
 > +------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
 > | Field      | Value

 > +------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
 > | id         | c1f0f190-5194-4bd7-a20a-d753d613a102

 > | location   | cloud='', project.domain_id='default',

 > project.name='admin', region_name='RegionOne', zone= |

 >                                                                    
 >                                         |
 > | shared     | False                                               
 >                                                                    
 >                                         |
 > +------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+

Hello, yes this behavior is intentional. It allows distinguishing owned and shared objects. But this behavior is not touched in this change."}, {'account_id': 14232, 'date': '2020-03-19 10:13:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-02 16:02:45.000000000', 'message': 'Stabilize functional tests

If a driver.spawn fails without triggering a re-schedule then the
placement cleanup and the compute build failure counter update
happens after every externally observable change (instance
state change, instance fault recording, notification sending) in
the finally block of _locked_do_build_and_run_instance() call.

We have couple of functional tests that assert either the placement
cleanup or the state of the build counter. These tests are unstable as
the test races with the compute manager code. As there are no externally
visible change to wait for this patch introduces a one second sleep to
these tests to stabilize them.

Closes-Bug: #1870385

Change-Id: I68369e7fa7630a212f4b20fc09f4c40796934bb9
'}, {'created': '2020-04-03 13:46:41.000000000', 'message': 'Stabilize functional tests

If a driver.spawn fails without triggering a re-schedule then the
placement cleanup and the compute build failure counter update
happens after every externally observable change (instance
state change, instance fault recording, notification sending) in
the finally block of _locked_do_build_and_run_instance() call.

We have couple of functional tests that assert either the placement
cleanup or the state of the build counter. These tests are unstable as
the test races with the compute manager code. As there are no externally
visible change to wait for this patch introduces some retry to
these tests to stabilize them.

Closes-Bug: #1870385

Change-Id: I68369e7fa7630a212f4b20fc09f4c40796934bb9
'}]
commit_message:
Stabilize functional tests

If a driver.spawn fails without triggering a re-schedule then the
placement cleanup and the compute build failure counter update
happens after every externally observable change (instance
state change, instance fault recording, notification sending) in
the finally block of _locked_do_build_and_run_instance() call.

We have couple of functional tests that assert either the placement
cleanup or the state of the build counter. These tests are unstable as
the test races with the compute manager code. As there are no externally
visible change to wait for this patch introduces some retry to
these tests to stabilize them.

Closes-Bug: #1870385

Change-Id: I68369e7fa7630a212f4b20fc09f4c40796934bb9

commit_message:
Use application_url in API version document

This handles the possible vhost in Glance API path correctly
(like https://cloud.example.com/image) contrary to host_url.

Change-Id: If86d805ddc46944e3aa2785aa5d775fe15b8468c
Closes-Bug: #1823703

commit_message:
Disallow setting default on internal network

The ``--default`` option should be only used for external network.
Default internal network is not currently supported so we disallow
it for now.

Change-Id: Ia9d39b40e1e041d7bda0f6a27d058e382b572e1a
Closes-Bug: #1745658

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg:
  * Wheel is not needed for python 3 only repo
  * Some other sections are obsolete
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore

Change-Id: Ia739f33b3db2c15a8c2eb6143134587f31591cfd

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore

Change-Id: Iae9f2460b5274663119b5e82699e55277859f5e7

subject: Use memcached for cache backend in keystone
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 5046, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'email': 'lbragstad@redhat.com', 'username': 'ldbragst'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 8833, 'name': 'Rabi Mishra', 'email': 'ramishra@redhat.com', 'username': 'rabi'}, {'_account_id': 9592, 'name': 'wes hayutin', 'email': 'whayutin@redhat.com', 'username': 'weshayutin'}, {'_account_id': 9816, 'name': 'Takashi Kajinami', 'email': 'tkajinam@redhat.com', 'username': 'kajinamit'}, {'_account_id': 11090, 'name': 'Sergii Golovatiuk', 'email': 'sgolovat@redhat.com', 'username': 'holser'}, {'_account_id': 11166, 'name': 'Lukas Bezdicka', 'email': 'social@v3.sk', 'username': 'xbezdick'}, {'_account_id': 13861, 'name': 'yatin', 'email': 'ykarel@redhat.com', 'username': 'yatinkarel'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 17823, 'name': 'Michele Baldessari', 'email': 'michele@redhat.com', 'username': 'mbaldessari'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2019-10-23 02:39:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11090, 'date': '2019-10-23 09:33:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2019-10-23 14:33:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2019-10-23 14:56:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

While reverting change related to keystone cache[1], we noticed cache in keystone is enabled by default, because keystone overrides default in oslo.cache.
As we also have token/caching=true by default, it would much effective to use shared memcache instead of using node local cache, and this is what I propose in this patch.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/688771/

I added some reviewers who involved in that reverting, so that I can get their feedback.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2019-10-23 15:00:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

Does it change the default behavior so that keystone starts using shared memcache instead of a node local cach? If so, that needs a bigger blessing from HA team'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-10-28 20:36:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2019-10-29 06:27:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-10-29 19:30:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2019-10-30 02:39:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

Thank you, Rabi and Alex for your feedback.
Please find my replies inline.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2019-10-30 05:13:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2019-12-09 05:27:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2019-12-09 08:02:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11166, 'date': '2019-12-09 10:48:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I don't think this should go to puppet-tripleo. This module should get trimmed down as it's mostly just failure to understand hiera overrides. There should be just include of keystone and that's it.

Have look at 
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/634505/8/environments/memcached_servers.yaml
and
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/638425/4/environments/undercloud.yaml

The discussion kinda killed the progress as well as attempts to solve passing multiple ipv6 memcached servers. Conclusion was to use just local machine and always cache locally but there wasn't conclusive performance testing done."}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-01-26 12:35:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Hi Lukas,

Sorry for my late reply for your feedback.

> I don't think this should go to puppet-tripleo. This module should get trimmed down
> as it's mostly just failure to understand hiera overrides.
> There should be just include of keystone and that's it.

I agree that implementing memcached configuration in puppet-tripleo makes
it difficult to understand how we pass its hieradata.
However we alreay have many places where we generate memcache configuration
in puppet-tripleo, so I still think it is valid to follow that way in this patch
and then consider about more proper way as an independent work.

> Conclusion was to use just local machine and always cache locally 
> but there wasn't conclusive performance testing done.

agreed. I'll check some pome performance result,
or will make it optional so that only users who really want
to have it will use clustered memcache as cache backend."}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-01-26 12:37:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-01-26 12:38:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-02-27 07:10:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-02-27 07:12:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Just rebased on master.

> Conclusion was to use just local machine and always cache locally but there wasn't conclusive performance testing done.

I believe the following downstream but describe the performance improvements by enabling clusted cache instead of local one.

 https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1584529"}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-03-10 02:06:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-03-10 22:23:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

I want to get Lance's feedback on it; I just want to make sure there won't be performance issue etc."}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2020-03-17 19:59:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> I want to get Lance's feedback on it; I just want to make sure
 > there won't be performance issue etc.

Caching currently isn't enabled, is it?

By default, is memcached going to be co-located with each keystone service? If so, we shouldn't expect to see any performance improvements until each individual cache is warmed up. We may need to look into additional changes to allow keystone process across controllers to share a cache, which would improve performance even more."}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-03-18 09:28:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

> cache co-located with each keystone service

would be the most safe path to start with from the "no caching at all" point.

> keystone process across controllers to share a cache

there may be corner cases in HA failover scenarios. That option would require a careful destructive HA testing. It should not be a default w/o proper CI coverage for destructive HA IMO.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-03-18 13:54:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

my comment has been replied in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/683010/

now I think we may want to give it a try after scale testing and destruction HA testing executed as a separate effort.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-03-18 14:32:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Sorry that I put my comment on a wrong patch... let me repost it here.

@Bogdan thank you for checking that.


> Caching currently isn't enabled, is it?

By default, keystone enables global caching wile it disables caching for the other modules than token.

We have null backend in oslo.cache layer by default, but keystone independently implements
_ResponseCacheProxy[1] class for caching, which is enabled when token caching enabled.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/keystone/common/cache/_context_cache.py

# Because this caching by _ResponseCacheProxy is disabled when we exiplicitly disable caching,
# we observed huge performance degradation when we land previous patch[2], which was reverted
# a while ago.

[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/683012/ and https://review.opendev.org/#/c/683010/


This _ResponseCacheProxy depends on request context managed by oslo.context,
and request context is thread local.

This means that token is cached per thread.
This per-thread caching is really insufficient because we have several workers and several nodes
running in real deployment, and having shared cache backend improves performance without any warm up.


> By default, is memcached going to be co-located with each keystone service? ...

No. If we enable dogpile.cache.memcached and pass multiple memcached servers,
keystone will talk to one of these memcached servers based on the hash generated
from key, so all keystone processes on all keystone servers can view the same data.


> there may be corner cases in HA failover scenarios. That option would require a careful
> destructive HA testing. It should not be a default w/o proper CI coverage for destructive HA IMO.

Thanks to the implementation in python-memcache, if one node goes down, client should try to connect
to a next server, so in general we don't expect service failure even if one of these memcache servers
are not availabe.

This loadbalancing/failover mechanism is implemented in python-memcached, which is generally used in OpenStack.

IIUC authtoken uses the same mechanism to cache token validation result in memcache.
So this is not really new things implemented in current TripleO deplotment.
(Though I still agree that we need HA testing)

Please refer the following code to find loadbalancing/failover processes in python-memcached.

https://github.com/linsomniac/python-memcached/blob/master/memcache.py#L422-L440"}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-04-06 10:31:56.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Let me abandon this patch because I submitted another patch to implement the same, which I believe is better than implementing all in puppet-tripleo.

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/717003'}]

This patch makes keystone use memcached for its cache backend,
as we expect controller cluster consists of multiple nodes.

Note:
We have dogpile.cache.memcached configured as cache backend
by default, which is recommended for environments with less than
100 threaded servers.

Change-Id: Ib8bf07bb577fc133b2c1efadb91ef8d577778f55

We have dogpile.cache.memcached configured as cache backend
by default, which is recommended for environments with less than
100 threaded servers.

Change-Id: Ib8bf07bb577fc133b2c1efadb91ef8d577778f55

commit_message:
Use memcached for cache backend in keystone

This patch makes keystone use memcached for its cache backend,
as we expect controller cluster consists of multiple nodes.

Note:
We have dogpile.cache.memcached configured as cache backend
by default, which is recommended for environments with less than
100 threaded servers.

Change-Id: Ib8bf07bb577fc133b2c1efadb91ef8d577778f55

[{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-03-16 12:59:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-03-16 13:01:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 29100, 'date': '2020-03-16 14:05:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

(2 comments)

Separating into two passes makes this much saner. Left some comments based on behavior I've seen. 

For context, our build pipeline using Kolla is different than yours. We rely heavily on regexes to filter what we build and have separate build pipelines for each major service (e.g., Ironic vs. Neutron vs. Nova, etc.) We do this because we maintain forks of most of them and push/pull patches and don't want to rebuild the entire set of services every time. We handle common ancestors like openstack-base by building them in a separate job. The general expectation of our system is "if it matches my regex, it should always be built": we don't use skip_existing for this reason so should be unaffected by change in behavior there.

In general I think this will not break any of our workflows, but history has told me that this code can often express itself in funny ways :)'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-03-16 14:28:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-16 12:59:43.000000000', 'message': 'Fix --skip-existing and --skip-parents

There are currently a few corner cases with the --skip-existing and
--skip-parents flags. Examples:

1. kolla-build --type source --skip-parents monasca-grafana

This does not try to build the monasca-grafana image. This appears to be
an issue when the image is a grandchild.

2. kolla-build --type source --skip-parents

This will build all images. Expect it to skip parents.

3. kolla-build --type source --skip-existing

This will build all images. Expect it to skip existing images.

The filter_images method does quite a lot, including handling
whether images are buildable, regex/profile matching, and which images
to skip. The matching and skipping parts are done in a single pass,
which can lead to some weird effects due to dependencies between the
images and their statuses. Also, skipping is only currently applied when
there is a regex/profile filter.

This change splits out the matching and skipping into two separate
passes. In the first pass, we mark all buildable images that match the
filter as matched. In the second, we iterate over matched images,
applying the skip existing and skip parents rules.

Change-Id: I2f895aea0cc59d808129e9fc636af0890196af33
Closes-Bug: #1867614
Related-Bug: #1810979

commit_message:
Fix --skip-existing and --skip-parents

There are currently a few corner cases with the --skip-existing and
--skip-parents flags. Examples:

1. kolla-build --type source --skip-parents monasca-grafana

This does not try to build the monasca-grafana image. This appears to be
an issue when the image is a grandchild.

2. kolla-build --type source --skip-parents

This will build all images. Expect it to skip parents.

3. kolla-build --type source --skip-existing

This will build all images. Expect it to skip existing images.

The filter_images method does quite a lot, including handling
whether images are buildable, regex/profile matching, and which images
to skip. The matching and skipping parts are done in a single pass,
which can lead to some weird effects due to dependencies between the
images and their statuses. Also, skipping is only currently applied when
there is a regex/profile filter.

This change splits out the matching and skipping into two separate
passes. In the first pass, we mark all buildable images that match the
filter as matched. In the second, we iterate over matched images,
applying the skip existing and skip parents rules.

Change-Id: I2f895aea0cc59d808129e9fc636af0890196af33
Closes-Bug: #1867614
Related-Bug: #1810979

The test was failing with an exception if the amphora key file was not
found or readable at the skip check. It should instead be skipped by

commit_message:
Fix skip check in active-standby test

The test was failing with an exception if the amphora key file was not
found or readable at the skip check. It should instead be skipped by
raising a skipException.

Change-Id: If3912f418aad33845f7f9bfbd6919931798af87b

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore
- Use sphinx-build for doc building everywhere

Change-Id: I1ebce1290995c89cb91a1227ee9473bf820606f3

commit_message:
osd upgrade: sleep between status checks

Perform a sleep at the end of the status check loop to avoid
spamming the OSD admin socket continually.

Change-Id: I1d05d0da5010fa16fcdb794c3bcf9d3416aa046a
Related-Bug: 1821028
(cherry picked from commit b61b4d170b7023d6567864dd55458570015ca196)

[{'created': '2020-03-26 13:57:50.000000000', 'message': "Get rid of the old container images environment file.

For more than three releases, the way to configure the container
images is by using the ContainerImagePrepare service (via the
container-prepare-parameters.yaml file). However, the update
implementation still kept a reference to the old environment
file which contained all the references to the container images.

"}]
commit_message:
Get rid of the old container images environment file.

For more than three releases, the way to configure the container
images is by using the ContainerImagePrepare service (via the
container-prepare-parameters.yaml file). However, the update
implementation still kept a reference to the old environment
file which contained all the references to the container images.
This file needs to be removed completely from the update prepare
and converge templates, as if the content isn't updated then
the update will point to the old images. This way we rely only
on the container-prepare-parameter.yaml content.

Change-Id: I11767c9c0c398f479ded14db1163693c6e87f621

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg:
  * Wheel is not needed for python 3 only repo
  * Some other sections are obsolete
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore

Change-Id: I57dc2210d369cb89ad2de7d2c304a8f225fd6adf

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-25 09:02:34.000000000', 'message': 'Do not race when applying puppet/rsync in containers

When puppet configures related service containers, like ironic
or nova services, there is potential rsync --delete-after race
condition with other rsync or puppet executions in parallel
containers.

Use flock to coordinate those. When a lock cannot be acquired for
either puppet or rsync after a 10 sec timeout, just fail it and allow
for retries to handle it.

Change-Id: I486ebf009cc1fc7d1cf2ce947fdd5c112930d125
Closes-bug: #1868934
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2020-03-25 09:06:29.000000000', 'message': 'Do not race when applying puppet/rsync in containers

When puppet configures related service containers, like ironic
or nova services, there is potential rsync --delete-after race
condition with other rsync or puppet executions in parallel
containers.

Use flock to coordinate those. When a lock cannot be acquired for
either puppet or rsync after a 10 sec timeout, just fail it and allow
for retries to handle it.

Change-Id: I486ebf009cc1fc7d1cf2ce947fdd5c112930d125
Closes-bug: #1868934
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2020-03-25 09:37:54.000000000', 'message': "Do not race when applying puppet/rsync in containers

When puppet configures related service containers, like ironic
or nova services, there is potential rsync --delete-after race
condition with other rsync or puppet executions in parallel
containers.

Use flock to coordinate those. When a lock cannot be acquired for
either puppet or rsync after a 10 sec timeout, just fail it and allow
for retries to handle it.

In order to discover related config containers, use the common part of
its config volume prefixes. For example, container-puppet-nova_libvirt
and container-puppet-nova_api will have their shared locks stored in
the host's /var/lock/containers/nova/container-puppet dir also
bind-mounted as /var/lock/container-puppet for any of the other
container-puppet-nova_* config containers.

Change-Id: I486ebf009cc1fc7d1cf2ce947fdd5c112930d125
Closes-bug: #1868934
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2020-03-25 09:51:18.000000000', 'message': "Do not race when applying puppet/rsync in containers

When puppet configures related service containers, like ironic
or nova services, there is potential rsync --delete-after race
condition with other rsync or puppet executions in parallel
containers.

Use flock to coordinate those. When a lock cannot be acquired for
either puppet or rsync after a 10 sec timeout, just fail it and allow
for retries to handle it.

In order to discover related config containers, use the common part of
its config volume prefixes. For example, container-puppet-nova_libvirt
and container-puppet-nova_api will have their shared locks stored in
the host's /var/lock/containers/nova/container-puppet dir also
bind-mounted as /var/lock/container-puppet for any of the other
container-puppet-nova_* config containers.

Also, in order to keep the timestamps of the puppet-generated/rsynced
files clean and isolated, release the lock only after all the required
timestamp-sensitive manipulations are done. That also provides better
isolation of configs and fences related services from unnecessary
restarts caused by unrelated config changes. Even if any made it
into config files having the same name, like nova.conf, but in fact
had been targeting different nova services.

Change-Id: I486ebf009cc1fc7d1cf2ce947fdd5c112930d125
Closes-bug: #1868934
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2020-03-26 09:52:32.000000000', 'message': 'Do not race when applying puppet/rsync in containers

When puppet configures related service containers, like ironic
or nova services, there is potential rsync --delete-after race
condition with other rsync or puppet executions in parallel
containers.

Use flock to coordinate those. When a lock cannot be acquired for
either puppet or rsync after a 10 sec timeout, just fail it and allow
for retries to handle it.

Also, in order to keep the timestamps of the puppet-generated/rsynced
files clean and isolated, release the lock only after all the required
timestamp-sensitive manipulations are done. That also provides better
isolation of configs and fences related services from unnecessary
restarts caused by unrelated config changes. Even if any made it
into config files having the same name, like nova.conf, but in fact
had been targeting different nova services.

Change-Id: I486ebf009cc1fc7d1cf2ce947fdd5c112930d125
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/715144
Closes-bug: #1868934
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2020-03-31 09:12:47.000000000', 'message': 'Do not race when applying puppet/rsync in containers

When puppet configures related service containers, like ironic
or nova services, there is potential rsync --delete-after race
condition with other rsync or puppet executions in parallel
containers.

Use flock to coordinate those. When a lock cannot be acquired for
a puppet run, just exit it immediately to be retried later. For rsync,
fail waiting for a lock after a 30 sec timeout, then allow
for retries to handle it. The reasoning behind the exiting vs waiting
choises is that normally puppet execution takes for a 20-30
seconds, and rsync is much faster. So we allow rsync to wait for any of
it. But if we exit it immediately each time, including puppet AND rsync
cases, that would only create unnecessary re-executions of puppet and
more locking/waiting (because puppet&rsync is an "atomic" action and
one assumes another).

We use a special exit status 110 (Connection timed out) for containers
to be retried with tripleo-ansible.

Also, in order to keep the timestamps of the puppet-generated/rsynced
files clean and isolated, release the lock only after all the required
timestamp-sensitive manipulations are done. That also provides better
isolation of configs and fences related services from unnecessary
restarts caused by unrelated config changes. Even if any made it
into config files having the same name, like nova.conf, but in fact
had been targeting different nova services.

Change-Id: I486ebf009cc1fc7d1cf2ce947fdd5c112930d125
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/715144
Closes-bug: #1868934
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2020-04-01 11:07:01.000000000', 'message': 'Do not race when applying puppet/rsync in containers

When puppet configures related service containers, like ironic
services that share /var/lib, there is potential rsync --delete-after race
condition with other rsync or puppet executions in parallel containers.

To fix that, if rsync fails, exit with code 75 to be retried later.
Error code 24 is also considered as "must be retried".

Change-Id: I486ebf009cc1fc7d1cf2ce947fdd5c112930d125
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/716547
Closes-bug: #1868934
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Do not race when applying puppet/rsync in containers

When puppet configures related service containers, like ironic
services that share /var/lib, there is potential rsync --delete-after race
condition with other rsync or puppet executions in parallel containers.

To fix that, if rsync fails, exit with code 75 to be retried later.
Error code 24 is also considered as "must be retried".

Change-Id: I486ebf009cc1fc7d1cf2ce947fdd5c112930d125
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/716547
Closes-bug: #1868934
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Allow retries when create podman containers

Before considered failed, allow containers to be retried for a limited
amount of times and using short delays between retries. Retry only if
a container has exited with a status matching the given values.

Change-Id: I2f5b5c15f75c9af9ba6d8d8b5325e248ef61986d
Related-bug: #1868934
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
osd upgrade: sleep between status checks

Perform a sleep at the end of the status check loop to avoid
spamming the OSD admin socket continually.

Change-Id: I1d05d0da5010fa16fcdb794c3bcf9d3416aa046a
Related-Bug: 1821028

subject: Workaround for cinder A/A and etcd with TLS-everywhere
messages: [{'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2020-03-31 20:49:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2020-04-01 13:03:10.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to bug/1869955'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-04-03 14:22:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-04-04 17:07:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-04-06 09:30:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nthis seems to have a doc impact for edge DCN'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-31 20:49:10.000000000', 'message': 'Workaround for cinder A/A and etcd with TLS-everywhere

This patch implements a workaround to allow cinder to run in active/
active mode with internal TLS enabled. Cinder uses etcd for its
distributed lock manager, and the LP bug documents several problems
when the deployment enables TLS on the internal API network.

Until a full solution is available, this workaround allows cinder and
etcd to work without TLS. The full solution is complicated, and affects
components outside of tripleo.

Change-Id: Iec0d02f8f51067098dd58beb4fe57a7fd5ab5651
Related-Bug: #1869955
'}]
commit_message:
Workaround for cinder A/A and etcd with TLS-everywhere

This patch implements a workaround to allow cinder to run in active/
active mode with internal TLS enabled. Cinder uses etcd for its
distributed lock manager, and the LP bug documents several problems
when the deployment enables TLS on the internal API network.

Until a full solution is available, this workaround allows cinder and
etcd to work without TLS. The full solution is complicated, and affects
components outside of tripleo.

Change-Id: Iec0d02f8f51067098dd58beb4fe57a7fd5ab5651
Related-Bug: #1869955

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg:
  * Wheel is not needed for python 3 only repo
- Update classifiers

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I1e848340faa096f1eede7397c2ea8988b8cbf75d

commit_message:
Update master for stable/ussuri

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/ussuri.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/ussuri.

Change-Id: I6de696d33244b5e93393f7b7d876baa1ecb1562f
Sem-Ver: feature

Just to move this forward'}, {'account_id': 30695, 'date': '2020-03-31 12:06:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 30695, 'date': '2020-03-31 12:09:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

(2 comments)

> Pedro, I still have a question here:
 > > Also, I do have a question here. How can we remove a description
 > after it was added?
 > 
 > Can you clarify that doubt as well?


Sure. As the Neutron's API has a default value for the description field, I think you can't delete the description, all that you can do is just leaving the default value, which is an empty string.

But I do not know some reason why someone would delete a rule's description. If the rule has changed, so the description should change to fit the new rule, otherwise, you can have some misunderstanding.

Anyway, nothing would prevent you to put only a blank space in the description :-)"}, {'account_id': 30695, 'date': '2020-03-31 14:04:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 30695, 'date': '2020-03-31 17:16:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 30695, 'date': '2020-03-31 19:49:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 28356, 'date': '2020-03-31 23:20:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2020-04-01 07:20:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2020-04-01 07:37:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 30695, 'date': '2020-04-01 12:14:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 28356, 'date': '2020-04-01 13:35:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2020-04-01 13:59:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2020-04-02 08:04:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-04-02 10:26:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review-1

Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore

Change-Id: I7ff8e50b0277eb3652dee5ab074c8fcae8be1935

[{'created': '2020-03-26 11:18:42.000000000', 'message': 'Ussuri contributor docs community goal

This patch updates the contributor documentation to follow

[{'created': '2020-04-03 15:18:01.000000000', 'message': 'Make MessageRegistryFile.Registry attribute non-required

According to Redfish schema, MessageRegistryFile.Registry
attribute is required and should specify some prefix for
the accompanying messages.

It turned out, that certain vendor does not supply this
attribute in Redfish response message. That makes sushy
exploding on attempt to fetch any resource from BMC.

This patch makes the above mentioned attribute defaulted
to some nonsense what will make sushy logging the problem,
but not exploding.

It is not entirely clear if the client could make sense
of the messages without this "Registry" prefix though.

Story: 2006641
Task: 36864
Change-Id: Ie8f867c7d824db156af8b874acae45d6496014a7
(cherry picked from commit 8177e66462ac83e527cc96f92e4ea6c391737570)
'}]
commit_message:
Make MessageRegistryFile.Registry attribute non-required

According to Redfish schema, MessageRegistryFile.Registry
attribute is required and should specify some prefix for
the accompanying messages.

It turned out, that certain vendor does not supply this
attribute in Redfish response message. That makes sushy
exploding on attempt to fetch any resource from BMC.

This patch makes the above mentioned attribute defaulted
to some nonsense what will make sushy logging the problem,
but not exploding.

It is not entirely clear if the client could make sense
of the messages without this "Registry" prefix though.

Story: 2006641
Task: 36864
Change-Id: Ie8f867c7d824db156af8b874acae45d6496014a7
(cherry picked from commit 8177e66462ac83e527cc96f92e4ea6c391737570)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-03 16:11:44.000000000', 'message': 'Make deploy step failure logging indicate the error

Deploy step logging would previously only log the step to the API
user, instead of anything the API user could use to try and determine
what is wrong.

Example:
- Trying to power on a machine as part of deploy.deploy()
- Power-on operation fails
- Only the deploy step is listed as the error, and no
  additional information to troubleshoot the issue,
  which forced the operator to go examine logs and
  find the error.

Change-Id: If60b96dcafa446de090df56089760eda3a21109d
(cherry picked from commit 6a1d453ef0dd9536e500ff8c45846826dca40e8b)
'}]
commit_message:
Make deploy step failure logging indicate the error

Deploy step logging would previously only log the step to the API
user, instead of anything the API user could use to try and determine
what is wrong.

Example:
- Trying to power on a machine as part of deploy.deploy()
- Power-on operation fails
- Only the deploy step is listed as the error, and no
  additional information to troubleshoot the issue,
  which forced the operator to go examine logs and
  find the error.

Change-Id: If60b96dcafa446de090df56089760eda3a21109d
(cherry picked from commit 6a1d453ef0dd9536e500ff8c45846826dca40e8b)

centos-release-opstools-1-9.el8.noarch is now installing but then:

2020-04-01 17:53:29.770108 | primary | INFO:kolla.common.utils.base:\x1b[91mCannot find a valid baseurl for repo: centos-opstools
2020-04-01 17:53:29.770176 | primary | INFO:kolla.common.utils.base:\x1b[0m

2020-04-01 17:53:34.143160 | primary | INFO:kolla.common.utils.base:\x1b[0m'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2020-04-02 06:41:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> centos-release-opstools-1-9.el8.noarch is now installing but then:
 > 
 > 2020-04-01 17:53:29.770108 | primary | INFO:kolla.common.utils.base:\x1b[91mCannot
 > find a valid baseurl for repo: centos-opstools
 > 2020-04-01 17:53:29.770176 | primary | INFO:kolla.common.utils.base:\x1b[0m
 > 2020-04-01 17:53:29.813678 | primary | INFO:kolla.common.utils.base:CentOS-8
 > - PowerTools                            48 MB/s | 2.0 MB     00:00
 > ...
 > 2020-04-01 17:53:31.498965 | primary | INFO:kolla.common.utils.base:Extra
 > Packages for Enterprise Linux 8 - x86_64   74 MB/s | 6.2 MB    
 > 00:00
 > 2020-04-01 17:53:34.143071 | primary | INFO:kolla.common.utils.base:\x1b[91mIgnoring
 > repositories: centos-opstools
 > 2020-04-01 17:53:34.143160 | primary | INFO:kolla.common.utils.base:\x1b[0m

That's because centos ops tools repo file doesn't have baseurl entry:
[centos-opstools]
name=CentOS-8 - OpsTools - collectd
mirrorlist=http://mirrorlist.centos.org/?arch=$basearch&release=$releasever&repo=opstools-collectd-5
gpgcheck=1
enabled=1
skip_if_unavailable=1
gpgkey=file:///etc/pki/rpm-gpg/RPM-GPG-KEY-CentOS-SIG-OpsTools

and we run sed to set the baseurl to use OpenDev mirror in tests/templates/template_overrides.j2:
sed
        -e "s|^#baseurl=http://mirror.centos.org|baseurl=http://{{ nodepool_mirror_host }}|" 

Can centos-release-opstools repo file include #baseurl=http://mirror.centos.org/bla/bla?'}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2020-04-02 06:48:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I have been asked not to use a baseurl, but a mirrorlist.

It should definitely be possible to use a sed command to replace the mirrorlist line by a baseurl.'}, {'account_id': 31539, 'date': '2020-04-02 07:28:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

mirrorlist line is currently being deleted:
https://github.com/openstack/kolla/blob/master/tests/templates/template_overrides.j2#L70
Line 70 could be replaced with:
-e "s|^mirrorlist|baseurl|" \

Would it brake something else or is it safe to make that change?'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2020-04-02 07:34:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> mirrorlist line is currently being deleted:
 > https://github.com/openstack/kolla/blob/master/tests/templates/template_overrides.j2#L70
 > Line 70 could be replaced with:
 > -e "s|^mirrorlist|baseurl|" \
 > 
 > Would it brake something else or is it safe to make that change?

This is applied in base and to all repo files we have for CentOS, I would be happier if we would change one non-standard repo file, instead of adapting sed to that one file :)|
Second problem is - that url path for mirrorlist is different than for baseurl, so we would need to rewrite it for each repo...'}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2020-04-02 08:19:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I can add a comment pointing to the baseurl. Will do that right now, the same as for CentOS Base repo, e.g

That will need another build though, and folks able to do that are in the US.'}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2020-04-02 08:30:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

https://git.centos.org/rpms/centos-release-opstools/c/fbf0d16860ce69f6423c803accadf846016a7028?branch=c8-sig-opstools'}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2020-04-03 05:35:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 31539, 'date': '2020-04-03 09:12:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Looks like centos-release-opstools-1-9.el8.noarch  was used again. I think that when recheck was run there wasn't 1.10 package on http://mirror.dfw.rax.opendev.org/centos/8/extras/x86_64/os/Packages/ yet, now it is up there so recheck might help."}, {'account_id': 31539, 'date': '2020-04-03 09:12:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-04-03 12:48:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 31539, 'date': '2020-04-03 13:01:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-04-03 13:22:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-04-03 16:54:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2020-04-06 07:42:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Thank you!

Piotr, could you please backport this to stable/train?'}]

commit_message:
add dpdk_telemetry and logparser, use centos-release-opstools for C8

Adds collectd-dpdk_telemetry and collectd-logparser packages
to collectd RHEL-based image. dpdk_telemetry plugin collects DPDK
ethernet device metrics via dpdk_telemetry library. Logparser is
plugin for filtering and parsing log messages.

Change-Id: I0c7c94e9fae9d11660f938b8d7d6be0f270c972f

for virtual functions.

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-05 06:20:31.000000000', 'message': 'Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg:
  * Wheel is not needed for python 3 only repo
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore

Change-Id: I12ecea6b3cfcca8edd5adedac91f906d77f4ff36
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg:
  * Wheel is not needed for python 3 only repo
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore

Change-Id: I12ecea6b3cfcca8edd5adedac91f906d77f4ff36

Update hacking for Python3

The repo is Python 3 now, so update hacking to version 3.0 which
supports Python 3.

Fix problems found by updated hacking version.

Remove hacking and friends from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during installation.

during installation.

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-05 23:32:28.000000000', 'message': "Prevent share type deletion if linked to group types

Share types can be associated with share group
types. This relationship needs to be dropped in
case share types are to be deleted, or we'll be
leaving behind dead references in the database.
Share groups cannot exist without share group
types, and hence we don't need to check on existing
groups when deleting share types; checking for
existing group types will suffice.

Change-Id: Ibb6e8ffc54283027588300ddc3cfdb8b8b42b815
Closes-Bug: #1699836
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Prevent share type deletion if linked to group types

Share types can be associated with share group
types. This relationship needs to be dropped in
case share types are to be deleted, or we'll be
leaving behind dead references in the database.
Share groups cannot exist without share group
types, and hence we don't need to check on existing
groups when deleting share types; checking for
existing group types will suffice.

Change-Id: Ibb6e8ffc54283027588300ddc3cfdb8b8b42b815
Closes-Bug: #1699836
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
tox: Keeping going with docs

Sphinx 1.8 introduced [1] the '--keep-going' argument which, as its name
suggests, keeps the build running when it encounters non-fatal errors.
This is exceptionally useful in avoiding a continuous edit-build loop
when undertaking large doc reworks where multiple errors may be
introduced.

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/commit/e3483e9b045

Change-Id: I4c5149bbbcf6344f65e2372fb943a81f85a491f2

commit_message:
tox: Keeping going with docs

Sphinx 1.8 introduced [1] the '--keep-going' argument which, as its name
suggests, keeps the build running when it encounters non-fatal errors.
This is exceptionally useful in avoiding a continuous edit-build loop
when undertaking large doc reworks where multiple errors may be
introduced.
