commit_message:
tox: Keeping going with docs

1. Sphinx 1.8 introduced [1] the '--keep-going' argument which, as its name
suggests, keeps the build running when it encounters non-fatal errors.
This is exceptionally useful in avoiding a continuous edit-build loop
when undertaking large doc reworks where multiple errors may be
introduced.

2. Clean "python setup.py build_sphinx" up and use "sphinx-build"
consistently[2]

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/commit/e3483e9b045
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html#documentation

Change-Id: Idaea51fdc68186d02fe5439eeb2a9883979ad27d

[{'account_id': 22165, 'date': '2019-10-24 11:57:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28471, 'date': '2019-11-13 13:54:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27822, 'date': '2019-11-20 08:24:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2020-01-10 15:23:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2020-01-10 16:08:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

On retrospect, I'm not sure this is a good idea.

If you're working on a big docs change, then you should probably set this parameter locally first, make your changes, and finally submit when its all working.

Setting this means that the build can break and we would not know about it."}, {'account_id': 22165, 'date': '2020-04-06 01:28:20.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
tox: Keeping going with docs

Sphinx 1.8 introduced [1] the '--keep-going' argument which, as its name
suggests, keeps the build running when it encounters non-fatal errors.
This is exceptionally useful in avoiding a continuous edit-build loop
when undertaking large doc reworks where multiple errors may be
introduced.

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/commit/e3483e9b045

Change-Id: I507d32b3e381849fdebe0b68a586930802e1c11f

commit_message:
tox: Keeping going with docs

1. Sphinx 1.8 introduced [1] the '--keep-going' argument which, as its name
suggests, keeps the build running when it encounters non-fatal errors.
This is exceptionally useful in avoiding a continuous edit-build loop
when undertaking large doc reworks where multiple errors may be
introduced.

2. Remove the duplicated sphinxcontrib-svg2pdfconverter from
test-requirements.txt

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/commit/e3483e9b045

Change-Id: Iff6e9e782b7185393dd2c96a51a4573299845602

commit_message:
Update json module to jsonutils

oslo project provide jsonutils, and magnum-tempest-plugin use it
in many place[1], this PS to update the remained json module to
oslo jsonutils for consistency.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/magnum-tempest-plugin/search?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=jsonutils&type=

Change-Id: I488f9af98a24dbeeced38dfa8bf0164550e01d04

Add keystone_region_name to magnum::keystone::domain

Is used to configure the trust/trustee_keystone_region_name
configuration option.

(cherry picked from commit 7faad823d1b62b1d2b07fc84a8fe62f9aae04653)

[{'created': '2020-04-04 15:07:00.000000000', 'message': 'Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore
- Remove html_last_updated_fmt from conf.py, this is not needed with
  openstackdocstheme anymore; update openstackdocstheme requirement

Change-Id: I66d7b502349de38bc2b646ed99cf5a41471d81bf
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore
- Remove html_last_updated_fmt from conf.py, this is not needed with
  openstackdocstheme anymore; update openstackdocstheme requirement

Change-Id: I66d7b502349de38bc2b646ed99cf5a41471d81bf

commit_message:
Enable back mac spoofing and disabled port security tests

We can enable back the mac spoofing test because
[1] has been merged [2]. Because of [1] we can now
rollback [3] to make port security tests with
disabled security works.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1805709
[2] https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/patch/1258152
[3] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/708852/

Change-Id: I008f3ce08346520b415f6db41419a69d472350a9

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-02 13:59:39.000000000', 'message': 'Replace ctype.CDLL by ctypes.PyDLL in linux.ip_lib

Some linux.ip_lib functions make use of "ctype.CDLL" methods
(create_netns, remove_netns). Those methods are called inside a
"privsep" context; that means the function reference and the
arguments are passed to a privileged context that will execute
the method.

"privsep" library makes use of eventlet to implement multitasking.
If the method executed returns the GIL, nothing guarantees that
the "eventlet" executor will return it again to this task. This
could lead to timeouts during the execution of those methods.

From https://docs.python.org/3.6/library/ctypes.html#ctypes.PyDLL:
  "Instances of this class behave like CDLL instances, except that
   the Python GIL is not released during the function call, and
   after the function execution the Python error flag is checked."

Change-Id: I36ef9bf59e9c93f50464457a5d9a968738844079
Closes-Bug: #1870352
'}]
commit_message:
Replace ctype.CDLL by ctypes.PyDLL in linux.ip_lib

Some linux.ip_lib functions make use of "ctype.CDLL" methods
(create_netns, remove_netns). Those methods are called inside a
"privsep" context; that means the function reference and the
arguments are passed to a privileged context that will execute
the method.

"privsep" library makes use of eventlet to implement multitasking.
If the method executed returns the GIL, nothing guarantees that
the "eventlet" executor will return it again to this task. This
could lead to timeouts during the execution of those methods.

From https://docs.python.org/3.6/library/ctypes.html#ctypes.PyDLL:
  "Instances of this class behave like CDLL instances, except that
   the Python GIL is not released during the function call, and
   after the function execution the Python error flag is checked."

Change-Id: I36ef9bf59e9c93f50464457a5d9a968738844079
Closes-Bug: #1870352

Dell SC: Fixes mapping between server and volume

Fixing the volume mapping to the server in the
backend to ensure the next use of available lun.

commit_message:
Release final monasca-common for ussuri

Final ussuri non-client lib release for the April 2 deadline.

Please leave +1 if we are all set and can proceed. Leave -1 if we
need to wait a little bit longer for something final to land,
then update it with a better commit hash to use for the release
when ready.

Patches with no response will be approved a few days after the
deadline.

Change-Id: I967a31c6cc6637234439f55c84145ebccb51b0e0
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-01 15:55:25.000000000', 'message': 'Add trunk subports to be one of dvr serviced device owners

When "trunk:subport" wasn't added to the list of device owners which
are supported by dvr, there was no proper config in br-int's openflow
rules for such port, e.g. there was no dvr_to_src_mac rule in table 1
added and traffic from such port was never going through br-int.

Trunk ports should be added to this dvr serviced device owners list and
that patch is adding it there.

Change-Id: Ic21089adfa32dbf5d0e29a89713e6e2bf28f0f05
Closes-Bug: #1870114
'}]
commit_message:
Add trunk subports to be one of dvr serviced device owners

When "trunk:subport" wasn't added to the list of device owners which
are supported by dvr, there was no proper config in br-int's openflow
rules for such port, e.g. there was no dvr_to_src_mac rule in table 1
added and traffic from such port was never going through br-int.

Trunk ports should be added to this dvr serviced device owners list and
that patch is adding it there.

Change-Id: Ic21089adfa32dbf5d0e29a89713e6e2bf28f0f05
Closes-Bug: #1870114

subject: [ussuri][goal] Updates for python 2.7 drop
messages: [{'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-03-02 01:23:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2020-04-05 17:59:30.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nretiring role'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-02 01:23:00.000000000', 'message': '[ussuri][goal] Updates for python 2.7 drop

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Only update required is in tox to define common baspython as py3 os that
all tox env including [testenv:functional] will use py3 instead of py2.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Updates for python 2.7 drop

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Only update required is in tox to define common baspython as py3 os that
all tox env including [testenv:functional] will use py3 instead of py2.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: I427d52d66d6f4bd60c1f91cf67eb68c04c5bd411

commit_message:
tox: Keeping going with docs

1. Sphinx 1.8 introduced [1] the '--keep-going' argument which, as its name
suggests, keeps the build running when it encounters non-fatal errors.
This is exceptionally useful in avoiding a continuous edit-build loop
when undertaking large doc reworks where multiple errors may be
introduced.
2. Remove the unnecessary blank line for tox.ini

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/commit/e3483e9b045

Depends-On: Ie837d376bb1a1d93367369d25140dd8a9d5ac14eocs
Change-Id: Ia1e06abea1a70ca7e89f3ea4a5ca3f6ce9e24882

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I1eae97c73528266bd5435244e5d56dc284453d2f

commit_message:
Increase MANILA_SERVICE_VM_FLAVOR_DISK

The manila service image was recently rebuilt and is
now bigger than 2 Gibibytes so increase it to 3, which
should last us for a while.

Closes-bug: #1870412

Change-Id: Ia03e48a3f0ff352b94a0224f76f278ef45acad93
(cherry picked from commit c0ee00f2c749dfb2de587a5c1220d1683e6204b9)
(cherry picked from commit f071a43e1b40cc08d7e6745959b0d6ebdc353519)

subject: Add unit test that measures aggregated output from configure_ovs
messages: [{'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2020-04-03 19:09:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2020-04-03 19:09:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 20635, 'date': '2020-04-03 20:12:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\ncharm-recheck'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2020-04-05 16:02:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2020-04-05 16:24:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-03 19:09:09.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Add unit test that measures aggregated output from configure_ovs

To be able to safely refactor and extract parts of the
``configure_ovs`` function from the ``neutron-openvswitch`` charm
we need a unit test for configure_ovs that measures its output
to Open vSwitch.

The Open vSwitch CLI provided by ``ovs-vsctl`` is rich, and multiple
combinations and orders of arguments can be used to accomplish
exactly the same programming of the system.

A side effect of any refactoring of this part of the code will lead
to change in order of which things are called, so we want to be able
to test that the expected set of ``ovs-vsctl`` sentences are called
regardless of in which order they arrive.

Change-Id: I2b4272ceb6148950065c737691e823b9a7f63760
'}, {'created': '2020-04-05 16:02:33.000000000', 'message': 'Add unit test that measures aggregated output from configure_ovs

The Open vSwitch CLI provided by ``ovs-vsctl`` is rich, and multiple
combinations and orders of arguments can be used to accomplish

A side effect of any refactoring of this part of the code will lead

Change-Id: I2b4272ceb6148950065c737691e823b9a7f63760

A side effect of any refactoring of this part of the code will lead

Change-Id: I2b4272ceb6148950065c737691e823b9a7f63760

commit_message:
Add unit test that measures aggregated output from configure_ovs

To be able to safely refactor and extract parts of the
``configure_ovs`` function from the ``neutron-openvswitch`` charm
we need a unit test for configure_ovs that measures its output
to Open vSwitch.

The Open vSwitch CLI provided by ``ovs-vsctl`` is rich, and multiple
combinations and orders of arguments can be used to accomplish
exactly the same programming of the system.

A side effect of any refactoring of this part of the code will lead
to change in order of which things are called, so we want to be able
to test that the expected set of ``ovs-vsctl`` sentences are called
regardless of in which order they arrive.

Change-Id: I2b4272ceb6148950065c737691e823b9a7f63760

commit_message:
manila share container name variable

manila share container name variable is fixed in some places,
but in the defaults directory, manila share container_name variable
is variable. If the manila share container_name variable is changed
during deployment, it will not be assigned to container name,
but a fixed 'manila_share' name.

Change-Id: Iea23c62518add8d6820b76b16edd3221906b0ffb

Congratulations, you've proposed your first change in OpenDev.

Your submission will now be tested automatically by Zuul, our gatekeeper,
and reviewed by other friendly developers. They will give you feedback and
may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches often take days (and sometimes weeks) to get reviewed, so be
patient. Don't hesitate to ask for help, and answer questions about your
work promptly if you can. The more you get to know reviewers and get to be
known by them, the smoother the review and approval process will become. The
fastest way to accomplish this is by reviewing other proposed changes
yourself: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for participating in OpenDev, we look forward to seeing you
around.

commit_message:
rabbitmq: update cluster version on reconfigure

This fixes https://bugs.launchpad.net/kolla-ansible/+bug/1731142. The
solution is to bump a version number of the cluster configuration
file (/etc/kolla/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-clusterer.config) every time
RabbitMQ configuration files change.

Closes-bug: #1731142
Change-Id: I26cce92e52b2ba6b905658e11d794c65e361f545

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-01 21:16:39.000000000', 'message': 'Add minimal policy.json template for Ussuri

As of OpenStack Ussuri, Glance has removed policy.json in favor
of using default policy in code. In order to continue supporting
the restrict-image-location-operations config option, a minimal
policy.json template is rendered for Ussuri and above. This allows
update_image_location_policy() to continue making modifications
to get_image_location, set_image_location, and delete_image_location
policy.

Change-Id: I7e3693ffda01d6a6269e771ecfd232ad2c87ce74
'}]
commit_message:
Add minimal policy.json template for Ussuri

As of OpenStack Ussuri, Glance has removed policy.json in favor
of using default policy in code. In order to continue supporting
the restrict-image-location-operations config option, a minimal
policy.json template is rendered for Ussuri and above. This allows
update_image_location_policy() to continue making modifications
to get_image_location, set_image_location, and delete_image_location
policy.

Change-Id: I7e3693ffda01d6a6269e771ecfd232ad2c87ce74

commit_message:
Update json module to jsonutils

oslo project provide jsonutils, and the others use it in many place,
this PS to update the json moudule to oslo jsonutils for consistency.

Change-Id: I3502f8f9e15cfc718f6665fb1c4f350e0cb05c0e

commit_message:
func tests: move _run_periodics() into own mixin

There are two almost identical implementations of the _run_periodics()
helper - and a third one would have joined them in a subsequent patch,
if not for this patch. This patch creates a new ServicesHelperMixin
to contain the _run_periodics() helper. That way, any test class
that needs the helper can inherit from the new mixin. Because
_run_periodics() depends on the self.computes dictionary populated by
the _start_compute() helper, those two things are moved to the new
mixin as well.

This enables some light refactoring of existing tests that need
either the _run_periodics() helper, or the compute service tracking.

In addition, a needless override of _start_compute() in
test_aggregates that provided no added value is removed. This is done
to avoid any potential confusion around _start_compute()'s role.

Change-Id: I36dd64dc272ea1743995b3b696323a9431666489

commit_message:
Disable Rocky periodic publishing jobs

Rocky is now in Extended Maintenance, and we have agreed to stop
publishing images at this point.

Change-Id: Ic746207e5816d3b1a09f183048dcfc7605f718d8

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-03 09:07:41.000000000', 'message': 'CI: Use upper constraints to install clients

Stein & earlier only

Some dependencies of client libraries (openstacksdk) have released
packages which do not support Python 2, but are not marked as such,
meaning that pip will install them. This breaks when the clients are
used, in this case in init-runonce:

    ImportError: No module named queue

This change fixes the issue by using upper constraints when installing
the clients.

Change-Id: I3272c0b8ebf6be957c120714a826a615246aa16b
Related-Bug: #1870349
(cherry picked from commit f3d2629a728802e5319f0bbae11071272696a1b7)

commit_message:
CI: Use upper constraints to install clients

Stein & earlier only

Some dependencies of client libraries (openstacksdk) have released
packages which do not support Python 2, but are not marked as such,
meaning that pip will install them. This breaks when the clients are
used, in this case in init-runonce:

    ImportError: No module named queue

This change fixes the issue by using upper constraints when installing
the clients.

Change-Id: I3272c0b8ebf6be957c120714a826a615246aa16b
Related-Bug: #1870349
(cherry picked from commit f3d2629a728802e5319f0bbae11071272696a1b7)

subject: Take into account last Rally moves
messages:
[{'account_id': 11692, 'date': '2020-03-22 17:34:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11692, 'date': '2020-03-22 17:36:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Not clear yet if it's enough to verify OpenStack (tempest)
https://build.opnfv.org/ci/job/functest-opnfv-functest-healthcheck-latest-tempest_smoke-run/754/console

Publishing this patchset helps us to validate the change in our Functest gates."}, {'account_id': 11692, 'date': '2020-03-22 17:38:11.000000000', 'content': 'Topic bug/1843282 removed'}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2020-03-22 18:26:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

hm... Sorry for breaking your CI :(

2 modules (yamlutils and dummy scenario) were moved in a backward incompatible way. I thought that they are inner and nothing should call it outside. rally-openstack should be compatible with latest rally without addressing deprecation warnings. https://review.opendev.org/#/c/714325/ gets them back. Please ping me if it doesn't help"}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2020-03-22 18:27:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

thanks for working on this and raising this issue'}, {'account_id': 11692, 'date': '2020-03-22 19:28:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

No problem for our CIs from the time being. It runs rally master and rally-openstack master which differ from the gate here.

I did apply another change in rally to run tempest via Rally.
Else this patch seems ok about tempest_smoke. I'm checking your new changes

https://build.opnfv.org/ci/job/functest-opnfv-functest-healthcheck-latest-tempest_smoke-run/755/console

$ git diff rally/common/fileutils.py 
diff --git a/rally/common/fileutils.py b/rally/common/fileutils.py
index 12cf8869d..9ad46df3c 100644
--- a/rally/common/fileutils.py
+++ b/rally/common/fileutils.py
@@ -19,12 +19,6 @@ import warnings
 import zipfile
 
 
-warnings.warn(
-    f"Module `{__name__}` is deprecated since Rally v3.0.0 and may be "
-    f"removed in further releases."
-)
-
-
 def pack_dir(source_directory, zip_name=None):
     """Archive content of the directory into .zip'}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2020-03-22 19:32:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

the warnings itself should not affect any test run...'}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2020-03-24 19:37:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

used in https://review.opendev.org/714479'}, {'account_id': 11692, 'date': '2020-04-05 09:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The warning bug is on our side!
Our console parsing failed due to the warnings. We fixed it in our side.'}, {'account_id': 11692, 'date': '2020-04-05 12:00:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I only noted one warning on rally side.
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/717589/

rally_openstack seems more than good. We did update our tasks because they were obsolete about boot_server_kwargs (glance and nova).

This change can be safely closed.

Thank you!'}, {'account_id': 11692, 'date': '2020-04-05 12:01:36.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

see https://review.opendev.org/#/c/714479/'}]

commit_message:
Take into account last Rally moves

It pins rally master in upper-contraints to validate the change [1].
It also removes all py27 jobs as Rally drops the support.

[1] https://build.opnfv.org/ci/job/functest-opnfv-functest-healthcheck-latest-tempest_smoke-run/754/console

Change-Id: I046f24cf2a6d22243eb9d69cea00640bd60c3e43
Signed-off-by: Cédric Ollivier <ollivier.cedric@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Increase MANILA_SERVICE_VM_FLAVOR_DISK

The manila service image was recently rebuilt and is
now bigger than 2 Gibibytes so increase it to 3, which
should last us for a while.

Closes-bug: #1870412

Change-Id: Ia03e48a3f0ff352b94a0224f76f278ef45acad93
(cherry picked from commit c0ee00f2c749dfb2de587a5c1220d1683e6204b9)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-03 08:32:04.000000000', 'message': 'Fix rabbitmq dependency

puppetlabs/rabbitmq [1] is deprecated, and max version is 5.6.0 which can
not be fulfilled by this dependency.

Correct it to puppet-rabbitmq [2] instead which is being actively maintained
and has the right version.

[1]: https://forge.puppet.com/puppetlabs/rabbitmq
[2]: https://forge.puppet.com/puppet/rabbitmq

Change-Id: I73d0c80af54de3d9c72291e9f1916058cd6bed02
Closes-Bug: #1850236
(cherry picked from commit 2d4ad36d4d8a5b6a0b2a4cc2a2b3c5bd8f01f134)
(cherry picked from commit 516c3c2b2f9d72f88b5dd3fcfa5bd06dfa542eab)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix rabbitmq dependency

puppetlabs/rabbitmq [1] is deprecated, and max version is 5.6.0 which can
not be fulfilled by this dependency.

Correct it to puppet-rabbitmq [2] instead which is being actively maintained
and has the right version.

[1]: https://forge.puppet.com/puppetlabs/rabbitmq
[2]: https://forge.puppet.com/puppet/rabbitmq

Change-Id: I73d0c80af54de3d9c72291e9f1916058cd6bed02
Closes-Bug: #1850236
(cherry picked from commit 2d4ad36d4d8a5b6a0b2a4cc2a2b3c5bd8f01f134)
(cherry picked from commit 516c3c2b2f9d72f88b5dd3fcfa5bd06dfa542eab)

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg:
  * Wheel is not needed for python 3 only repo
  * Some other sections are obsolete
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore

commit_message:
Add missing fields for HTTPS health monitors

Some fields (http method, expected codes, url path) are missing in
health monitor form when type is HTTPS.
These are valid parameters for HTTP and HTTPS health monitors.

Story: 2007512
Task: 39292

Update hacking for Python3

The repo is Python 3 now, so update hacking to version 3.0 which
supports Python 3.

Remove flake8 requires, hacking handles this.

Remove hacking and friends from lower-constraints, it's not needed
there.

messages: [{'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-04-02 22:39:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-04-02 22:42:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2020-04-02 22:58:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27427, 'date': '2020-04-03 10:42:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-04-03 13:56:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2020-04-03 14:00:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-04-05 04:59:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked\n\nThis patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/train as commit d6cd50b3750ec6777c4477b7a8830b7d333b62b2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-02 22:39:24.000000000', 'message': "Switch to podman_image module

By default the podman_image module has validate_certs enabled which
forces the --tls-verify flag. This prevents *any* insecure registry from
working. This is different from the default mechanism where SSL
registries are required unless explicitly defined in the insecure
registries list in /etc/containers/registries.conf. The undercloud
is an insecure registry so we don't want to force --tls-verify.

Change-Id: I47221977ceeddcfa8e2d3da719692ffe87379ac4
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to podman_image module

By default the podman_image module has validate_certs enabled which
forces the --tls-verify flag. This prevents *any* insecure registry from
working. This is different from the default mechanism where SSL
registries are required unless explicitly defined in the insecure
registries list in /etc/containers/registries.conf. The undercloud
is an insecure registry so we don't want to force --tls-verify.

Change-Id: I47221977ceeddcfa8e2d3da719692ffe87379ac4

commit_message:
Include {{step}} when setting facts

We don't set the fact specific to a step and it seems
to run those puppet tasks for subsequent steps too.

Change-Id: Ic276ea6f34dd638ad66505aa77bddff0e4071ad4
Closes-Bug #1870291

commit_message:
kolla-toolbox container name variable

kolla-toolbox container name variable is fixed in some places,
but in the defaults directory, kolla-toolbox container_name variable
is variable. If the kolla-toolbox container_name variable is changed
during deployment, it will not be assigned to kolla-toolbox,
but a fixed 'kolla-toolbox' name.

Change-Id: I9579017761ff47477dba597282be9ae6fab4242a

commit_message:
Change @property usage to function

osprofiler is walking through all the properties of a class when the
service is starting. Removing @property to avoid unneccesary code logic
running during service initialization.

Change-Id: I53635e167808de18093a15c871b6de7d94afc8d0

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-03 13:29:22.000000000', 'message': "Fetch containers early

Rather than wait until we run the container puppet process or paunch, we
should pull the containers after we setup the container engine. This
will allow us to fail early when containers aren't available and be able
to troubleshoot connectivity/auth issues seperately from configuration
problems.

commit_message:
Fetch containers early

Rather than wait until we run the container puppet process or paunch, we
should pull the containers after we setup the container engine. This
will allow us to fail early when containers aren't available and be able
to troubleshoot connectivity/auth issues seperately from configuration
problems.

Closes-Bug: #1870557
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/717326/
Change-Id: I9cb011dd4bed35a55a586e97a4e7d653f8296595
(cherry picked from commit 24fb2e3f5ef4fcde11ff6e92d318729b326b5d2b)

commit_message:
Do not fail if /usr/sbin/nft is not present

In change Ia4a2a58aada3b893fa23e04722f0a7d77e05a981 we added some rules
to forcefully cleanup nftables in case those were changed outside our
control. Turns out that some Centos8 CI jobs do not have it installed.
Let's not fail in that cases.

Change-Id: I693d2b3c9de7135416d809b625cff62184a10668
Closes-Bug: #1870095
(cherry picked from commit aa019cdd5d84b6678395c18ff536b804a8b10005)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-03 21:00:04.000000000', 'message': 'Stop building universal wheels

Hacking requires python >= 3.5, but we build universal wheels which are
valid under python2. This creates some confusion for people that expect
these wheels to then function under python2.

Avoid confusion by building python3 only wheels instead.

Change-Id: Ic1d957f711738ad4932e3d9c3356ab6d640aa373
'}]
commit_message:
Stop building universal wheels

Hacking requires python >= 3.5, but we build universal wheels which are
valid under python2. This creates some confusion for people that expect
these wheels to then function under python2.

Avoid confusion by building python3 only wheels instead.

Change-Id: Ic1d957f711738ad4932e3d9c3356ab6d640aa373

commit_message:
Small cleanups

Remove py2.7 lines from setup.py.
Remove obsolete build_sphinx lines from setup.cfg.
Remove html_last_updated_fmt from doc/source/conf.py, it's not needed
with newer openstackdocstheme.
Update openstackdocstheme requirement.
Update upper-constraints URL.

Change-Id: I492209291a39699dee1ea75e5109c4d1ac9c725f

messages: [{'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-04-04 03:46:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-04-04 03:46:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked\n\nThis patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/stein as commit b8381ced8438dd10010240a21ce086f719e322eb'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-04-04 17:20:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-04 03:46:02.000000000', 'message': "Improve container_images_file comments

Downstream we see that folks repeatedly forget to set this variable even
though they may generate a containers yaml file. This ultimately leads
to an undercloud installation failure due to lack of credentials. This
change updates the configuration item to be required=False for upstream
(because it's not) but includes additional comments around what this
file does. We can flip the configuration to required in environments
where we know we need authentication.

Change-Id: I8c26aa68ec2668fb9c94d0191914bd676e082ebe
(cherry picked from commit 24b87f1997fff08f610e685b4f5856de4e74dbec)
"}]
commit_message:
Improve container_images_file comments

Downstream we see that folks repeatedly forget to set this variable even
though they may generate a containers yaml file. This ultimately leads
to an undercloud installation failure due to lack of credentials. This
change updates the configuration item to be required=False for upstream
(because it's not) but includes additional comments around what this
file does. We can flip the configuration to required in environments
where we know we need authentication.

Change-Id: I8c26aa68ec2668fb9c94d0191914bd676e082ebe
(cherry picked from commit 24b87f1997fff08f610e685b4f5856de4e74dbec)

Looks like we're logging a variable that's not defined. As we're
logging all hashes together for a container, there is no point
probably logging the config volumes.

Looks like a regression from https://review.opendev.org/683286

Change-Id: I3c36b1d6f8de28c956dd3f38285afd349062bc14
Closes-Bug: #1870351
(cherry picked from commit 676643ed7db53c401c9fbe045cfda1c65d1667a3)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix regression in container-puppet.py

Looks like we're logging a variable that's not defined. As we're
logging all hashes together for a container, there is no point
probably logging the config volumes.

Looks like a regression from https://review.opendev.org/683286

Change-Id: I3c36b1d6f8de28c956dd3f38285afd349062bc14
Closes-Bug: #1870351
(cherry picked from commit 676643ed7db53c401c9fbe045cfda1c65d1667a3)

[{'created': '2020-04-04 09:34:01.000000000', 'message': 'Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg: Wheel is not needed for python
  3 only repo
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore
- remove html_last_updated_fmt from conf.py, this is set by
  the theme now.
- Remove hacking and friends from lower-contraints, those are not
  needed for installation.

Change-Id: I81d0926a6c03f0146320e9a46eb79e661ca72eee
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg: Wheel is not needed for python
  3 only repo
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore
- remove html_last_updated_fmt from conf.py, this is set by
  the theme now.
- Remove hacking and friends from lower-contraints, those are not
  needed for installation.

Change-Id: I81d0926a6c03f0146320e9a46eb79e661ca72eee

commit_message:
Sync charm-helpers for py38/focal pre-support

This is to enable other charms to pass there enable-focal patchsets.
The pre-enable is simply to sync in charmhelpers with py38 support so
that this charm can participate in swift-proxy's focal enablement.

Change-Id: Ic94761fd65e9f442fa08315bbbdc377d7d0a97c9

CI: Ansiblify setup of builders

CI is set up using Ansible playbooks now.
This also drops redundant shell scripts.

[{'created': '2020-03-15 14:37:26.000000000', 'message': "CI: Avoid tox

builds.
Tox is going away from base infra images.
It's already gone from aarch64 (arm64) ones.

commit_message:
CI: Avoid tox

We don't need tox nor tell our users to use it when doing kolla builds.

Tox is going away from base infra images (it is already gone from
aarch64 ones).

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/713134
Co-authored-by: Marcin Juszkiewicz <marcin.juszkiewicz@linaro.org>

Change-Id: Ib1d97a783951ac42740ebf91bcc6ecaf2bf70853

The repo is Python 3 now, so update hacking to version 3.0 which
supports Python 3.

Fix problems found.

Remove hacking and friends from lower-constraints, they are not
installed in a running system.

'}]
commit_message:
Update hacking for Python3

The repo is Python 3 now, so update hacking to version 3.0 which
supports Python 3.

Fix problems found.

Remove hacking and friends from lower-constraints, they are not
installed in a running system.

Change-Id: Ia62b221aa0807300eaee7b075607ac6b56256b76

subject: Release final mistral-extra for ussuri
messages:
[{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-04-01 20:10:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-04-01 20:24:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-04-02 09:59:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Are sure we can consider [1] as a fix?

It rather looks like to a new feature (new entrypoint etc...).

Thoughts?

[1] https://github.com/openstack/mistral-extra/commit/b615bd4b48a97e8f90dc64cd89e890cc2e688a43'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2020-04-03 02:48:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2020-04-03 02:49:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Are you planning to do the same for mistral-lib?'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-04-03 14:48:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

> Are you planning to do the same for mistral-lib?

I think we could say yes but I let's Sean confirm that.
If you want to cut on a specific change then you could do this too on your side (for mistral-lib).

Any update about my previous question and my concern about the new entrypoint and the fact that we released a fixing version instead of a minore version?

Only +1 for now by waiting more updates"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-04-04 16:17:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

> Are you planning to do the same for mistral-lib?

There weren't any changes merged to mistral-lib when I checked. If something has merged since April 1 that needs to be released, please propose a release patch."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-01 20:10:55.000000000', 'message': 'Release final mistral-extra for ussuri

Final ussuri non-client lib release for the April 2 deadline.

Please leave +1 if we are all set and can proceed. Leave -1 if we
need to wait a little bit longer for something final to land,
then update it with a better commit hash to use for the release
when ready.

Patches with no response will be approved a few days after the
deadline.

Change-Id: Ie486e6a25460b04a54f6f69e3afe74876bc31501
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Release final mistral-extra for ussuri

Final ussuri non-client lib release for the April 2 deadline.

Please leave +1 if we are all set and can proceed. Leave -1 if we
need to wait a little bit longer for something final to land,
then update it with a better commit hash to use for the release
when ready.

Patches with no response will be approved a few days after the
deadline.

Change-Id: Ie486e6a25460b04a54f6f69e3afe74876bc31501
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

subject: Cleanup py27 support
messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-04-04 15:22:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2020-04-04 16:06:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-04 15:22:39.000000000', 'message': 'Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore

Change-Id: Ia4bd000671f39aaf4dffbfa060dd87775d6a6cc3

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore

Change-Id: Ia4bd000671f39aaf4dffbfa060dd87775d6a6cc3

commit_message:
CI: Avoid tox (and clean up gate setup)

We don't need tox nor tell our users to use it when doing kolla
builds.
Tox is going away from base infra images.
It's already gone from aarch64 (arm64) ones.

Change-Id: I2eb5203ad93c011b8806f4b6fb56db081c14a2cb

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg:
  * Wheel is not needed for python 3 only repo
  * Some other sections are obsolete
- Update classifiers

Change-Id: Id417aaae518b18d220998ed6520fd729fec0a501

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ibb435d31c3223ecde33822db604ff06f32ab495e

commit_message:
Update master for stable/ussuri

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/ussuri.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/ussuri.

Sem-Ver: feature

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-17 18:01:35.000000000', 'message': 'Fix multiple issues with MariaDB handling

These affected both deploy (and reconfigure) and upgrade
resulting in WSREP issues, failed deploys or need to
recover the cluster.

This patch makes sure k-a does not abruptly terminate
nodes to break cluster.
This is achieved by cleaner separation between stages
(bootstrap, restart current, deploy new) and 3 phases
for restarts (to keep the quorum).

Upgrade actions, which operate on a healthy cluster,
went to its section.

Service restart was refactored.

We no longer rely on the master/slave distinction as
all nodes are masters in Galera.

Backport includes also the:
Followup on MariaDB handling fixes

This fixes issues reported by Mark:
- possible failure with 4-node cluster (however unlikely)
- failure to stop all nodes from progressing when conditions are
  not valid (due to: "any_errors_fatal: False")
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/710586

Closes-bug: #1857908
Closes-bug: #1859145
Change-Id: I83600c69141714fc412df0976f49019a857655f5
(cherry picked from commit 9f14ad651a9e6516d02c90d9eb0ec4b7a4702e7e)

commit_message:
Fix multiple issues with MariaDB handling

These affected both deploy (and reconfigure) and upgrade
resulting in WSREP issues, failed deploys or need to
recover the cluster.

This patch makes sure k-a does not abruptly terminate
nodes to break cluster.
This is achieved by cleaner separation between stages
(bootstrap, restart current, deploy new) and 3 phases
for restarts (to keep the quorum).

Upgrade actions, which operate on a healthy cluster,
went to its section.

Service restart was refactored.

We no longer rely on the master/slave distinction as
all nodes are masters in Galera.

Backport includes also the:
Followup on MariaDB handling fixes

This fixes issues reported by Mark:
- possible failure with 4-node cluster (however unlikely)
- failure to stop all nodes from progressing when conditions are
  not valid (due to: "any_errors_fatal: False")
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/710586

Closes-bug: #1857908
Closes-bug: #1859145
Change-Id: I83600c69141714fc412df0976f49019a857655f5
(cherry picked from commit 9f14ad651a9e6516d02c90d9eb0ec4b7a4702e7e)

With a recent change[1], the nfs mounts will happen in the glance
container(and not in cinder container) due to which the glance
container requires the appropriate nfs packages to do the mount.
This patch adds those dependencies.

commit_message:
Add nfs dependencies to glance container

Glance API image lacked nfs programs/utils to be able to mount
NFS exports.
This affected Glance usage with Cinder backend when NFS was used
as Cinder backend.

Closes-Bug: #1868574

Change-Id: I3aac1e6a7f7c5f839b036f15713af949fba206cc

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Now that we no longer support py27, we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

Change-Id: I6ad6214a598760807572ab98ed9c359e7afdbc2f
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Update hacking for Python3

The repo is Python 3 now, so update hacking to version 3.0 which
supports Python 3.

Fix problems found by updated hacking version.

Update local hacking checks for new flake8.

Remove hacking from lower-constraints, it is not
needed in installations.

subject: Remove default(omit) from openstack_cacert in templates
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-04-03 13:49:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-04-04 10:22:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nquick merge to avoid further confusion'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-03 13:49:41.000000000', 'message': 'Remove default(omit) from openstack_cacert in templates

The use of default(omit) is for module parameters, not templates. We
define a default value for openstack_cacert, so it should never be
undefined anyway.

Change-Id: Idfa73097ca168c76559dc4f3aa8bb30b7113ab28
'}]
commit_message:
Remove default(omit) from openstack_cacert in templates

The use of default(omit) is for module parameters, not templates. We
define a default value for openstack_cacert, so it should never be
undefined anyway.

Change-Id: Idfa73097ca168c76559dc4f3aa8bb30b7113ab28

commit_message:
Update hacking for Python3

The repo is Python 3 now, so update hacking to version 3.0 which
supports Python 3.

Fix problems found by updated hacking version.

Update local hacking checks for new flake8.

Remove hacking and friends from lower-constraints, they are not
needed in installations.

Change-Id: I67e5ca24c550163c218fb06692de0b7c528d8318

commit_message:
[k8s] Improve the taint of master node kubelet

Improve the taint of master node kubelet to get the conformance
test passed and update the OCCM and Helm/Tiller tolerations accordingly.

Task: 39223
Story: 2007256

Change-Id: Ief452e05ddf13a1d1ee77641311c3ae7abbe90f2

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Updates for python 2.7 drop

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

openstack-ansible repos only need updates on requirements
and tox file.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: Idf700e627b5c88059762690aec6dc3e3a345a39f

Benchmark of this patch on an upload of a 6GB file (same configuration than https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/swift-profiling)


Replica policy (3 replicas):
* Upload
  master: 5.62 Gbps / 844 jiffies
  watchdog: 7.29 Gbps (+30%) / 635 jiffies (-25%)

* Download
  master: 11.13 Gbps / 463 jiffies
  watchdog: 13.89 Gbps (+25%) / 371 jiffies (-20%)


Erasure Code policy (2+1):
* Upload
  master: 1.73 Gbps / 2964 jiffies
  watchdog: 1.81 Gbps (+5%) / 2835 jiffies (-4%)

* Download
  master: 4.69 Gbps / 1100 jiffies
  watchdog: 5.22 Gbps (+11%) / 991 jiffies (-10%)


The gain on EC is quite small because the real bottleneck is somewhere else (MD5, Queue). More patches to come to address that.'}, {'account_id': 13852, 'date': '2019-12-06 21:08:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(5 comments)

I just took a quick pass and left a few questions. I haven't tried testing it yet, wondering if I'd also be able to see the performance gains on a small saio.

At first glance, it seems the interface can be simplified further, but I need to play with it a bit more to understand. Also wondering if object server will be able to make use of it in the future."}, {'account_id': 13852, 'date': '2019-12-10 15:34:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 13852, 'date': '2019-12-10 15:44:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

 > performance gains on a small saio.

I think you should at least see a CPU usage reduction. About bandwidth increase, well I'm not sure you might be limited by your SAIO IO performances.

> Also wondering if object server will be able to make use of it in the future.

Yes, it should. I'm planning it, but I didn't want to mix things for this PR."}, {'account_id': 13852, 'date': '2020-03-04 21:43:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2020-03-05 04:18:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9625, 'date': '2020-03-05 13:51:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 9625, 'date': '2020-03-26 23:01:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

I took another look at this patch and it looks good to go. OTOH, I tried running some tests on my *saio VM* and couldn't really see any perf improvements (neither lower CPU usage nor higher throughput), so my hesitation to put a +A without more data on it. Any chance we might be able to post to the commit message the improvements that were seen by this patch?"}, {'account_id': 13852, 'date': '2020-03-27 23:07:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 13852, 'date': '2020-03-27 23:14:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/swift-profiling"}, {'account_id': 13852, 'date': '2020-04-02 11:39:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 13852, 'date': '2020-04-02 11:41:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(2 comments)

I think everyone has had enough time for this to sync in.

Sanity check swift-bench run on my saio with some random sleep calls in the object servers makes me pretty sure this isn't horribly broken.

Apr  3 12:16:30 saio proxy-server: ERROR with Object server 127.0.0.1:6040/sdb4 re: Trying to GET /v1/AUTH_test/db8eb79b577143f882b7cce038eca9a6_5/615c7fdca6674eafb8467e98827302e2: Timeout (10.0s) (txn: txf235d58e15354a47b91a0-005e87290a)

The only downside I can think of is maybe someone more confident in the eventlet codebase could have implemented something upstream that would benefit ALL the code paths - as it stands we'll want to do object server stuff next.

Can't wait to see my req/s workloads improve next upgrade.  Looks great!"}, {'account_id': 13852, 'date': '2020-04-03 14:06:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-06 11:53:05.000000000', 'message': 'Replace all "with Chunk*Timeout" by a watchdog

The contextmanager eventlet.timeout.Timeout is scheduling a call to
throw an exception every time is is entered. The swift-proxy uses
Chunk(Read|Write)Timeout for every chunk read/written from the client or
object-server. For a single upload/download of a big object, it means
tens of thousands of scheduling in eventlet, which is very costly.

This patch replace the usage of these context managers by a watchdog
greenthread that will schedule itself by sleeping until the next timeout
expiration. Then, only if a timeout expired, it will schedule a call to
throw the appropriate exception.

The gain on bandwidth and CPU usage is significant.

Change-Id: I19fd42908be5a6ac5905ba193967cd860cb27a0b
'}, {'created': '2019-12-06 14:01:50.000000000', 'message': 'Replace all "with Chunk*Timeout" by a watchdog

The contextmanager eventlet.timeout.Timeout is scheduling a call to
throw an exception every time is is entered. The swift-proxy uses
Chunk(Read|Write)Timeout for every chunk read/written from the client or
object-server. For a single upload/download of a big object, it means
tens of thousands of scheduling in eventlet, which is very costly.

This patch replace the usage of these context managers by a watchdog
greenthread that will schedule itself by sleeping until the next timeout
expiration. Then, only if a timeout expired, it will schedule a call to
throw the appropriate exception.

The gain on bandwidth and CPU usage is significant.

Change-Id: I19fd42908be5a6ac5905ba193967cd860cb27a0b
'}, {'created': '2019-12-06 15:11:13.000000000', 'message': 'Replace all "with Chunk*Timeout" by a watchdog

Chunk(Read|Write)Timeout for every chunk read/written from the client or
object-server. For a single upload/download of a big object, it means
tens of thousands of scheduling in eventlet, which is very costly.

This patch replace the usage of these context managers by a watchdog
greenthread that will schedule itself by sleeping until the next timeout
expiration. Then, only if a timeout expired, it will schedule a call to
throw the appropriate exception.

The gain on bandwidth and CPU usage is significant.

Change-Id: I19fd42908be5a6ac5905ba193967cd860cb27a0b

commit_message:
Replace all "with Chunk*Timeout" by a watchdog

The contextmanager eventlet.timeout.Timeout is scheduling a call to
throw an exception every time is is entered. The swift-proxy uses
Chunk(Read|Write)Timeout for every chunk read/written from the client or
object-server. For a single upload/download of a big object, it means
tens of thousands of scheduling in eventlet, which is very costly.

This patch replace the usage of these context managers by a watchdog
greenthread that will schedule itself by sleeping until the next timeout
expiration. Then, only if a timeout expired, it will schedule a call to
throw the appropriate exception.

The gain on bandwidth and CPU usage is significant. On a benchmark
environment, it gave this result for an upload of 6 Gbpson a replica
policy (average of 3 runs):
    master: 5.66 Gbps / 849 jiffies consumed by the proxy-server
    this patch: 7.56 Gbps / 618 jiffies consumed by the proxy-server

Change-Id: I19fd42908be5a6ac5905ba193967cd860cb27a0b

commit_message:
Add recursive get key from dict

The docker_config (and other data) that we have in tripleo is a complex
dict but we need a way to fetch a specific key from a larget structure.
This change adds a filter called recursive_get_key_from_dict which will
traverse all the dictionaries in a given dataset and return a list
containing all the values of the requested key.

Partial-Bug: #1870557
Change-Id: I952df4d4a7700eccdb2d49a7fba271518058771a
(cherry picked from commit c072a6bf9d3ca3e264ac9055af13c2a4385895b1)

[FIX] Fixes libvirt apparmor and gate jobs

This change refactors the apparmor job to utilize the feature
gates system instead of relying on separate scripts.

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Following openstack horizon change
I2de669d8e89b8daeb7ee5405ffab35af6307c40b

Now that we no longer support py27, we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

Unblocks currently broken pyX gates

Change-Id: Id140c0a13c9d2a2bfcd1d851a04407f232021eef
Closes-Bug: #1870436

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-31 21:39:07.000000000', 'message': "Improve container_images_file comments

Downstream we see that folks repeatedly forget to set this variable even
though they may generate a containers yaml file. This ultimately leads
to an undercloud installation failure due to lack of credentials. This
change updates the configuration item to be required=False for upstream
(because it's not) but includes additional comments around what this
file does. We can flip the configuration to required in environments
where we know we need authentication.

Change-Id: I8c26aa68ec2668fb9c94d0191914bd676e082ebe
"}, {'created': '2020-03-31 21:40:32.000000000', 'message': "Improve container_images_file comments

Downstream we see that folks repeatedly forget to set this variable even
though they may generate a containers yaml file. This ultimately leads
to an undercloud installation failure due to lack of credentials. This
change updates the configuration item to be required=False for upstream
(because it's not) but includes additional comments around what this
file does. We can flip the configuration to required in environments
where we know we need authentication.

Change-Id: I8c26aa68ec2668fb9c94d0191914bd676e082ebe
"}]
commit_message:
Improve container_images_file comments

Downstream we see that folks repeatedly forget to set this variable even
though they may generate a containers yaml file. This ultimately leads
to an undercloud installation failure due to lack of credentials. This
change updates the configuration item to be required=False for upstream
(because it's not) but includes additional comments around what this
file does. We can flip the configuration to required in environments
where we know we need authentication.

Change-Id: I8c26aa68ec2668fb9c94d0191914bd676e082ebe

commit_message:
Update hacking for Python3

The repo is Python 3 now, so update hacking to version 3.0 which
supports Python 3.

Fix problems found by updated hacking version.

Update local hacking checks for new flake8.

Remove hacking and friends from lower-constraints, they are not
needed in installations.

Change-Id: I6e6638c07b5d24c90e9deae277e98149f383eb3d

commit_message:
fcos: Disable zincati auto-updates

By default FCOS auto-updates nodes which causes
reboots as well. Disable the auto-update functionallity.

docs: https://github.com/coreos/zincati/blob/0.0.6/docs/usage/auto-updates.md#disabling-auto-updates

story: 2005201
task: 39029

Change-Id: I67a4eefdd9b11889b232a0d0a385087f98d3e85e
Signed-off-by: Spyros Trigazis <strigazi@gmail.com>

Pin puppet-lint-unquoted_string-check

... because puppet-lint-unquoted_string-check requires Ruby~>2.4, since
2.0.0, and causes failure in gate.

commit_message:
Remove mistral from the plan_undeploy workflows

This change removes the `stack_management.py` workflow file. This file
is being deleted because it is unused since we converted the overcloud
delete workbook.

Story: 2007212
Task: 38418

Change-Id: I8adf62fce31ecd69464c429d5988c8f171bb640f
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-30 15:02:45.000000000', 'message': 'Set scp_if_ssh to True in ansible client configuration

To avoid the warning "sftp transfer mechanism failed" during Ansible
run (also reported here:
https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/22127); let's set scp_if_ssh
to True.

The default is False; which means it'll first try sftp (which fails
since we use pipeline) and fallback on scp. To avoid the warning, let's
set it to True directly, so we use scp.

Closes-Bug: #1869735

Change-Id: I5474b45f4bbe15780370a23d587dea7dd811c073
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Set scp_if_ssh to True in ansible client configuration

To avoid the warning "sftp transfer mechanism failed" during Ansible
run (also reported here:
https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/22127); let's set scp_if_ssh
to True.

The default is False; which means it'll first try sftp (which fails
since we use pipeline) and fallback on scp. To avoid the warning, let's
set it to True directly, so we use scp.

Closes-Bug: #1869735

Change-Id: I5474b45f4bbe15780370a23d587dea7dd811c073
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix incorrect openswan package in CentOS8

This is a partial backport of f7bc1dc4f207f45cc561e933a65f048813f1b8d1,
and makes sure that we install libreswan instead of openswan in CentOS8
and RHEL8.

Change-Id: Ib47deec4a365a96e3e2b7972f65df089003bb68f
(cherry picked from commit 445eb54d984ebcd5c5f54b32910c0cb7d31f2d50)

This inteface is probably not used and does not work by default as

commit_message:
Remove overcloud remote execute command

This inteface is probably not used and does not work by default as
we've disabled os-collect-config on overcloud nodes since rocky.

This uses heat software deployments and swift temp url based signaling
which does not go with config-download and ansible based roadmap without
mistral and swift.

If required users/operators can write custom playbooks to do additional
configuration required on nodes.

Change-Id: I931bae6953b00290c006a02cc24c6c9718d5d6ac

[{'created': '2020-04-01 23:22:32.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "standalone: enable ConfigDebug by default"

This reverts commit 334271d8a3411c733ea328816b35dd4cc1d151b3.

This also enables puppet debug which is excessively verbose
leading to really large and consumable logs. I think this
should only be used when we're hitting problems and not on
by default.

Change-Id: Ibdb85f11cc9c1381b25092f54e946eff7118bcfd
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "standalone: enable ConfigDebug by default"

This reverts commit 334271d8a3411c733ea328816b35dd4cc1d151b3.

This also enables puppet debug which is excessively verbose
leading to really large and consumable logs. I think this
should only be used when we're hitting problems and not on
by default.

Change-Id: Ibdb85f11cc9c1381b25092f54e946eff7118bcfd

commit_message:
Fix hacking test requirement

A recent change [1] updated the hacking version
in manila-tempest-plugin and made corresponding
fixes but unfortunately is python 2 incompatible.
We really only need hacking on master anyways,
where we no longer support python 2, so here we
make the requirement specific to python 3.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/716559

Closes-bug: #1870621

Change-Id: I9771cf31d50dbbfc0eb978ffb8f485c431cf2767

commit_message:
Limit scope of puppet-neutron-tripleo-standalone tempest tests

This is the partial backport of the gate job fix[1] in master, which
limits scope of tempest tests executed in tripleo job to avoid timeout
error in gate jobs.

[1] 6cb1d1af735a0fbd2d811ec40fecbd7d1c987898

Conflicts:
	.zuul.yaml

Closes-Bug: #1870257
Change-Id: I6f72d6be245b5c530de0746fb8b7cec26748bb45
(cherry picked from commit 175f063b182c627100404621961371b73b7e6f03)

commit_message:
Update master for stable/ussuri

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/ussuri.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/ussuri.

Change-Id: Ib874927ce670ad387a3f86edfb8bbf278afc57a6
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
[ceph-osd] Fix creating osd-id file logic for log-runner container

This is to fix the issue with osd-id file creation since current
logic failing to create /tmp/osd-id file when we restart the pod/container.

Change-Id: Ie9f810fa3a705eccaf625a3cbd91d3d8ee4e05d1

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-03 14:58:41.000000000', 'message': 'Ignore failing message registry download

Redfish agent (running inside BMC) can hyperlink message
registries from other locations so that the client can download
and use them. Trouble is, that sometimes these hyperlinked
locations may not be available or the hyperlink itself can be
malformed (e.g. iLO).

This patch ignores essentially all errors caused by message
registry download. That effectively renders failed message
registry being absent.

Change-Id: Iebe69ed0f93b6ba0c2b3905f751c1f12ed5eac88
Story: 2007445
Task: 39106
(cherry picked from commit 4791814adf044120ebdc3927ec84af9522d63fac)
'}]
commit_message:
Ignore failing message registry download

Redfish agent (running inside BMC) can hyperlink message
registries from other locations so that the client can download
and use them. Trouble is, that sometimes these hyperlinked
locations may not be available or the hyperlink itself can be
malformed (e.g. iLO).

This patch ignores essentially all errors caused by message
registry download. That effectively renders failed message
registry being absent.

Change-Id: Iebe69ed0f93b6ba0c2b3905f751c1f12ed5eac88
Story: 2007445
Task: 39106
(cherry picked from commit 4791814adf044120ebdc3927ec84af9522d63fac)

commit_message:
Correct security groups policy check_str

security groups API policy is default to admin_or_owner[1]
but API is allowed (which is expected) for everyone.

This is because API does not pass the project_id in policy
target so that oslo policy can decide the ownership[2]. If no
target is passed then, policy.py add the default targets which
is nothing but context.project_id (allow for everyone try to access)
- https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/c16315165ce307c605cf4b608b2df3aa06f46982/nova/policy.py#L191

Passing the server project_id as target to make it admin_or_owner.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/7b51647f17c88c7c1ae321c59ab8a98c586d4b67/nova/policies/security_groups.py#L27
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/7b51647f17c88c7c1ae321c59ab8a98c586d4b67/nova/api/openstack/compute/security_groups.py#L427
[3] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/c16315165ce307c605cf4b608b2df3aa06f46982/nova/policy.py#L191

Change-Id: I7b09a8ff3ccbb74e5299bdf5775d286609bc5d4c
Closes-bug: #18670226

[{'created': '2020-04-01 20:19:22.000000000', 'message': "Use exec when spawning any neutron sidecar container

Similarly to dnsmasq [0], other processes can receive SIGHUP. This is
allowed by rootwrap filters for all processes [1], and I found some
examples when running neutron-tempest-plugin tests checking
l3-agent.log files:
Running command (rootwrap daemon): ['radvd-kill', 'HUP', '712810'] execute_rootwrap_daemon /usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/neutron/agent/linux/utils.py:103
Running command (rootwrap daemon): ['keepalived-kill', 'HUP', '402009'] execute_rootwrap_daemon /usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/neutron/agent/linux/utils.py:103

Change-Id: I31237d21527a2909a1669cb6c80cc0fa9be798a6
"}]
commit_message:
Use exec when spawning any neutron sidecar container

Similarly to dnsmasq [0], other processes can receive SIGHUP. This is
allowed by rootwrap filters for all processes [1], and I found some
examples when running neutron-tempest-plugin tests checking
l3-agent.log files:
Running command (rootwrap daemon): ['radvd-kill', 'HUP', '712810'] execute_rootwrap_daemon /usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/neutron/agent/linux/utils.py:103
Running command (rootwrap daemon): ['keepalived-kill', 'HUP', '402009'] execute_rootwrap_daemon /usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/neutron/agent/linux/utils.py:103

To prevent additional similar issues, apply similar fix for these
sidecar containers too

Related-Bug: #1867192

[0] I1af2ecd9e3996de4f43224f66a8bdb81eab07022
[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/src/branch/master/etc/neutron/rootwrap.d

Change-Id: I31237d21527a2909a1669cb6c80cc0fa9be798a6

When an operator run `source overcloudrc` then `source stackrc`,

commit_message:
Prevent duplicated hosts in overcloudrc no_proxy

When an operator runs `source overcloudrc` then `source stackrc`,
ENV['no_proxy'] keep having overcloud information because stackrc
doesn't include no_proxy line.
If they runs deploy commands like overcloud deploy with that situation,
the command is executed with ENV['no_proxy'] including overcloud hosts.
This generates overcloudrc with duplicated host in no_proxy line,
because no_proxy in overcloudrc is generated by joining ENV['no_proxy']
and rquired overcloud hosts.

This patch makes sure that duplicated hosts are removed before they get
dumped into no_proxy parameter.

Change-Id: I94934ae7631100d20a9e2e72e348f26bd595a3c5
Closes-Bug: #1870017

Switch from oslosphinx to openstackdocstheme

Sphinx versions, the current approach does no longer build.

(cherry picked from commit b4c304c5d61a044f3e57025a5e5b729550458dc5)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-07 07:45:28.000000000', 'message': 'WIP:Support query user message by timestamp

Add support for querying user messages by specifying a timestamp, which
will be compared to the created_at field, and manila will return all the
messages matching to the time condition.

Partially-Implements: blueprint query-user-message-by-timestamp

Change-Id: I3d94bac4304c236f275abe7ce31432b0e2384247
'}, {'created': '2020-02-08 06:04:48.000000000', 'message': 'WIP:Support query user message by timestamp

Add support for querying user messages by specifying a timestamp, which
will be compared to the created_at field, and manila will return all the
messages matching to the time condition.

Partially-Implements: blueprint query-user-message-by-timestamp

Change-Id: I3d94bac4304c236f275abe7ce31432b0e2384247
'}, {'created': '2020-02-08 06:44:56.000000000', 'message': 'WIP:Support query user message by timestamp

Add support for querying user messages by specifying a timestamp, which

commit_message:
Support query user message by timestamp

Add support for querying user messages by specifying a timestamp, which
will be compared to the created_at field, and manila will return all the
messages matching to the time condition.

Partially-Implements: blueprint query-user-message-by-timestamp

Change-Id: I3d94bac4304c236f275abe7ce31432b0e2384247

commit_message:
Release final openstacksdk for ussuri

Final ussuri non-client lib release for the April 2 deadline.

Please leave +1 if we are all set and can proceed. Leave -1 if we
need to wait a little bit longer for something final to land,
then update it with a better commit hash to use for the release
when ready.

Patches with no response will be approved a few days after the
deadline.

Change-Id: I7e7d858d43d453a33bf192a9c158fc0b216d3bed
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Remove OrchestrationDeployAction call in ffwd upgrade prepare

This was added for ffwd upgrade from N->Q, where we moved to use
scipt hook rather than os-apply-config. This does not seem relevant
any more is it would be removed for both normal upgrade[1] and ffwd
upgraded N->Q deployments.

Also, it won't be needed for Q->T ffu.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/560022

Change-Id: I5c55938b1c313e4ebf24f3babeb377e87bf7cd30

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-03 20:31:18.000000000', 'message': 'Install gpg tooling on dib images

This is particularly important for debuntu where we need working gpg for
apt and a missing gpg-agent is fatal. We install it globally so that
consistent tooling is available across systems.

Note everyone but suse seems to have a gnupg2 package. Suse calls it
gpg2.

Change-Id: I6c56e85db501f2c9d7c648e614f1efbaadc213a2
'}]
commit_message:
Install gpg tooling on dib images

This is particularly important for debuntu where we need working gpg for
apt and a missing gpg-agent is fatal. We install it globally so that
consistent tooling is available across systems.

Note everyone but suse seems to have a gnupg2 package. Suse calls it
gpg2.

Change-Id: I6c56e85db501f2c9d7c648e614f1efbaadc213a2

Out of curiosity, how are you using get/set_multi? I don't see that getting used anywhere in the codebase..."}, {'account_id': 28499, 'date': '2020-04-03 13:25:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 28499, 'date': '2020-04-03 13:35:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

For information, in an internal middleware, we set some metadatas about objects during head/get query and we need to get all these entries during container listing.
To speedup extraction on memcached servers, we use account/container as server_key with get_multi().'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-04-03 15:01:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Memcachering provided set_multi/get_multi to set/get list of key on an unique
memcached server selected in ring with server_key value. But current api doesn't

Change-Id: I24c29540ee4b91adeb7b9f44fe84bc4d46f89218

current api doesn't allow to deleted value save with set_multi.

This change add a server_key optional keyword to delete method to allow

Change-Id: I24c29540ee4b91adeb7b9f44fe84bc4d46f89218

commit_message:
Extend MemcacheRing.delete() API to manage server_key

Memcachering provided set_multi/get_multi to set/get list of key on an
unique memcached server selected in ring with server_key value. But
current api doesn't allow to deleted value save with set_multi.

This change add a server_key optional keyword to delete method to allow
to delete entry in the memcached selected with server_key instead of key.

Change-Id: I24c29540ee4b91adeb7b9f44fe84bc4d46f89218

commit_message:
Update hacking for Python3

The repo is Python 3 now, so update hacking to version 3.0 which
supports Python 3.

Fix problems found.

Change-Id: I76d42ef91d3cfc133a6f7a4dfdf982e5fec0d443

commit_message:
Support query user message by timestamp

add created_since and created_before to message-list API.

Depends-On: I3d94bac4304c236f275abe7ce31432b0e2384247
Change-Id: I91d00888d71aa3bc4a8c9aaa4d2a3e9d23d19286
Partially-Implements: blueprint query-user-message-by-timestamp

commit_message:
Remove idle_timeout option

The idle_timeout parameter has been deprecated for two releases.
We can remove it.

Change-Id: If31c73dbedf622ddfb51aca53e9c0b42d97c0f72

commit_message:
Check no specific group present in group list

Let's check no specific group present instead of list is empty
in test_group_snapshot_create_show_list_delete.
This maybe a reason of failed test due to some inconsistency.

Closes-Bug: #1869852
Change-Id: I41884567ae07b4d6a28667d2a3a792b63e1a6cfa

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-16 08:58:54.000000000', 'message': "Support force-deletion of servers.

If reclaim_instance_interval > 0 in nova.conf, some testcases will
fail cause of resource's state is 'in-use'. This patch adds one
option 'foce_delete_server' in section compute. Set True if
reclaim_instance_interval > 0 in nova.conf.

Change-Id: I406188ac2aa54419fa4e44f547ae80a31b58b858
Closes-Bug: #1850568
"}, {'created': '2020-01-11 09:23:23.000000000', 'message': "Support force-deletion of servers.

reclaim_instance_interval > 0 in nova.conf.

Closes-Bug: #1850568

If reclaim_instance_interval > 0 in nova.conf, some testcases will
fail cause of resource's state is 'in-use'. This patch adds the logic
in `wait_for_server_termination` that if the virtual machine state is

commit_message:
Support force-deletion of servers.

If reclaim_instance_interval > 0 in nova.conf, some testcases will
fail cause of resource's state is 'in-use'. This patch adds the logic
in `wait_for_server_termination` that if the virtual machine state is
 SOFT_DELETED, then call `force_delete`.

Change-Id: I406188ac2aa54419fa4e44f547ae80a31b58b858
Closes-Bug: #1850568

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-01 21:30:12.000000000', 'message': 'Add test coverage of existing security groups policies

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:
- policy check pass with context having admin or server owner
- policy check fail with context having non-admin and not server owner

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh, to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.

When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing security groups policies.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I212a91dc4b6c2eed9c6522d56ae672618311d346

commit_message:
Add test coverage of existing security groups policies

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:
- policy check pass with context having admin or server owner
- policy check fail with context having non-admin and not server owner

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh, to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.

When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing security groups policies.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I212a91dc4b6c2eed9c6522d56ae672618311d346

commit_message:
oslotest 4.2.0

This is just a revert of the mock removal patch because it broke a
number of consuming projects who were relying on oslotest to pull
in mock for them.

Change-Id: I66dee954493dcbe507db68ef1dd1db702a4338ad

Why this?

The patch that you're reverting (even though it can be ok to revert) was fixing a bug that let LSPs having 'unknown' and other addresses in the addresses field."}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2020-02-20 11:50:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Why this?
 > 
 > The patch that you're reverting (even though it can be ok to
 > revert) was fixing a bug that let LSPs having 'unknown' and other
 > addresses in the addresses field.

Yes, but it also introduced regression described in bug 1864027. Do we have any other solution for #1728886 than setting 'unknown' to all LSPs?"}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2020-02-20 12:59:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> > Why this?

 > > revert) was fixing a bug that let LSPs having 'unknown' and other
 > > addresses in the addresses field.
 > 
 > Yes, but it also introduced regression described in bug 1864027. Do
 > we have any other solution for #1728886 than setting 'unknown' to
 > all LSPs?

So you're saying that an LSP with port security disabled (== 'unknown')  is not getting DHCP? If so, looks like a core OVN bug.

I'd be willing to fix it properly rather than reverting a patch that is fixing a bug."}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2020-02-20 13:13:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Why this?
 > 
 > The patch that you're reverting (even though it can be ok to
 > revert) was fixing a bug that let LSPs having 'unknown' and other
 > addresses in the addresses field.

@Daniel, correct me if I am wrong. The reason for the change was because if there was any other addresses the unknown wasn't being respected by OVN ?"}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2020-02-20 15:38:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

It is a core-ovn related thing:
http://paste.openstack.org/show/789802/

While setting unknown the dhcp-realted lflows are removed.'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2020-02-20 16:09:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hmm.. Basically ovn-northd generates lflows per each IPv4 address to handle DHCP [0]. As we are setting the addresses column to 'unknown', we're clearing up the IP addresses and there's no info for northd to create the DHCP request.

Let's think what we can do :)

https://github.com/ovn-org/ovn/blob/master/northd/ovn-northd.c#L6270"}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2020-02-21 08:36:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

 >

Yeah, maybe we can stop looping over defined ips and just add a flow without ip match."}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2020-02-21 08:37:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Revert "[OVN] Set 'unknown' address properly when port sec is disabled"

We can now revert this patch, because main cause has been already
fixed in Core OVN [1]. With this fix the ARP responder flows are not
installed on LS pipeline, when LSP has port security disabled, and 
an 'unknown' address is set in addresses column.
This makes MAC spoofing possible.


[1] https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/patch/1258152/


This reverts commit 03b87ad963d5d8165a92e5c7c284c1517333dd00.



Change-Id: Ie4c87d325b671348e133d62818d99af147d50ca2
Closes-Bug: #1864027
